Reviews.Title: “poor value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Husa Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: This is an expensive 4 star hotel. The rooms are adequate, but fail to provide coffee/tea makiing facilities (except in the so-called "superior rooms"). This is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Exploding toilet”
Reviews.Author: GVA_lmb
Reviews.Content: Hotel is OK, nicely located etc. but 2 issues with it make me rate it average: 1. Internet (almost 20€ per day - give me a break we are in 2012)... 2. Our water system in the bathroom exploded during the morning after our 1 night stay. Called reception - room was getting full of water (was promised technician and ... 15 min nothing literary no one bothered to come). Went to reception and then get promised technician and cleaning lady. True they fixed and cleaned it, but no gesture offered. No "sorry Sir for annoyance", nada. Maybe I'm spoiled but would expect a minimum....

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel but charge for wifi”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: This was a clean, modern hotel, well located for all the main sights (about a 15 minute walk to sol). Having only paid just over £50 a night was very pleased with my choice, but frustratingly this is still one of the hotels that insist on charging for wifi

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Husa Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: i spent only 2 nights in the hotel, but I really enjoyed my staying. First the registration is very fast, second - good location, third - comfortable clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: fiona168
Reviews.Content: We stayed their for three dates. I booked more than 2 months in advance from booking.com at a non-refundable rates but I later find out that the rate keeps on decreasing. Later, I wrote to booking.com and the hotel reflecting my disappointment, they ultimately upgrade our room to a suite. The suite is very good; spacious , clean and sufficient facilities. Our room just facing the monument which has a great view though a bit noisy but you can close the window at nite. The only area of improvement is that its lightings are dim. The location is good, just next to metro station. but we didn't take it cos it is enjoyable to walk along the Avenida Liberade to the town centre. The buffet breakfast have many choices. Overall I am very satisfactory. Not sure whether the standard room will be as good as that.

Reviews.Title: “This is fabulous place to stay and explore Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: loreen_2004
Reviews.Content: After 3 weeks on the road travelling through Italy, Spain, Portugal and Morocco, I spent a couple nights at Husa Paseo del Arte before heading back to Canada. As a single female traveller, I felt safe, really appreciated the extra amenities and it was close to everything you would want to see in Madrid. The hop-on-hop-off bus was a 2 minute walk away and the Atocha train station 5-10 minutes walk depending on your luggage and traffic lights. Mike at the front desk was always extremely pleasant and helpful even though I peppered him with several questions during my stay. The rooms were clean, quiet and the AC worked very well. Everything you needed was at your finger tips, no attention to detail was left out. I would definitely recommend this place to stay while in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a excellent location”
Reviews.Author: neil7908
Reviews.Content: .Spent 2 nights here but were very impressed with the hotel. Room on the first floor was big with a nice bathroom and very clean and well kept (could be a little loud from the street below so if possible ask for a room higher up). Staff all great and spoke fantastic English. A stones throw from the Prado and other museums and also just a couple of minutes from one of the big railway stations in Madrid. Not too far a walk and a short subway to the Royal Palace and Plaza Espana. Only major complaint was that the internet was priced at 12 euros for 24 hours which seemed pretty steep.

Reviews.Title: “Good businessman hotel”
Reviews.Author: jnjdougan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and is very crisp and clean in character with clean neat little rooms....just perfect for a person who wants to get out and do business and not worry about hotel ambiance. We did not like paying for Wi Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Location & style with a business vibe”
Reviews.Author: scg128
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at Paseo del Arte. The hotel is perfectly functional, attractive - even stylish, & in a good location near a metro station & the Atocha train station, but it has a somewhat cold, business vibe. We arrived late our 1st night & got stuck in a smallish room overlooking an alley. There's a night club down the street from the hotel so when it shut down in the wee hours of the morning the alley was used as a short-cut by the clubbers & was very noisy. Moved the next day with a bit of a hassle at the front desk which kept trying to get us to upgrade [at an additional cost] to the executive level. Finally, we were given a slighter larger, front-facing room. The hotel is immaculate & superbly maintained. Staff were efficient, if a bit aloof. We felt the breakfast was overpriced so we walked across the street every morning where there are a number choices. Internet also overpriced - free wifi can be had a noisy, over crowded McDonalds down the street or at Starbucks across the street. The location's very convenient though I'd probably choose a different neighborhood next visit to Madrid. Being across the street from the Reina Sofia Museum (fabulous museum!) was great. It's a pleasant, 20 minute walk to the Prado & Botanical Gardens. Did a day trip to Toledo (a must!) & being so close to the train station was plus. Be aware that the nearby metro station has a lot of very steep stairs - would be pretty impossible to deal with luggage up & down those steps... Overall a pleasant enough experience. We paid $152/night booking through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: Emma H
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel in june - staff friendly and helpful - rooms very large and comfortable bed, location to the museums and atocha station quite convienient - lots of choice for breatfast - would recommend this hotel as a place to stay

Reviews.Title: “good start”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Husa Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to visit the city, nice room and bathroom (front side: sometimes little bit noisy due to the combination large windows/heavy traffic), very clean - everywhere, exquisite (almost overdone) breakfast, easy accessable parking. Staff is helpfull (for some members, the English language may need some improvement). We would definitifly come back to this hotel in case of a simular occasion.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location close to atocha station and art museums”
Reviews.Author: nutmeg06
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed four nights at the hotel ( beginning of July). I loved its proximity to the Atocha station. I had arrived by air, and caught the bus to the train station. The hotel is approx. a 5-7 min. walk from the station. As well, there is a metro station close by on the opposite side of the street. The hotel is very close to the Reina Sofia art museum and an easy 10 min. stroll to either the Prado or the Thyssen-Bournemisza along a shady wide boulevard. The hotel itself is a bit of a jewel on a somewhat shabby street. Nice lobby. Very helpful staff. The morning buffet was extensive . There are very few places to eat elsewhere nearby for breakfast if you need to eat early ( I was taking a couple of early morning departure day bus tours) so I did select the pay the additional charge for the buffet. The room itself was average. My room was located on a side alley, and I found it a bit noisy. But then again, all of Madrid was celebrating the Euro soccer win at the time of my stay. The hotel does have a restaurant but I did not eat there. It was a bit of a challenge to find places to eat dinner that were a short walk away from the hotel. As a single female traveler, I like to eat within a couple of blocks of my accomodation, especially when dining late, as is the custom in Madrid. Overall, I felt that this hotel provided good value for the money and I would certainly stay at this property again should I return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: jodydawn25
Reviews.Content: I have traveled a lot in Europe, so when I walked into this hotel I was shocked. Normally my budget of $200/night (about 140 Euros) doesn't get you far in the large cities...but this hotel was well worth the money. They didn't spend all their money in the lobby like most hotels in Europe. Whereas it is beautiful and they reception people are extremely helpful and bilingual, the rooms were well decorated and very spacious...especially for European standards. This is probably one of the largest rooms I've ever had in Europe (understanding I've slept in some pretty small closet-size rooms). It is modern and comfortable. The location is about a 10 minute walk from the main train station. The only drawbacks I noticed is that you aren't centrally located to a main metro (most of the time it was easier to walk to most of the places in Madrid) and the local restaurants near the hotel weren't very good. But, with a 10-15 minute walk up the street (away from the train station), there are several different areas you can venture to and enjoy great food. If I go back to Madrid, I will certainly look at staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: denverchucko
Reviews.Content: we took the bus into atocha station and walked 2 long blocks to this modern and comfortable hotel. we feared that the noise of the clubs next door and the busy street outside our window would too much, but we heard nothing. the location is across the street from riena sophia gallery and through retiro park to the prado. food at pl. santa ana or a little longer walk to plaza mayor. rooms were large, nicely furnished and the beds comfortable as could be. staff professional, helpful and attentive. what more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great service, lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Husa Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: We were sorry that we only stayed in Madrid for one night at this lovely hotel. The rooms are lovely, ours had a terrace. The location, across from the Reina Sofia Museum and the Atocha train stations, is so convenient. Our favorite part of the hotel was Mike at the reception desk. He was very friendly, unbelievably helpful and patient with our multitude of questions. We would definitely stay here and recommend it to our friends and family. Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: chicago_desi
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome. Right next to Prado and Reina Sofia and transportation and all the fun stuff is just a short walk away. Our room was nice, the staff was friendly and professional and the price was right. This incident, that I am about to share, isn't about the hotel but more generally about Madrid/Spain. I almost had my wallet stolen on the street right outside the hotel, in broad daylight, with a bunch of people out and about. I felt someone tug at my backpack and turned around to find a woman taking my wallet out. I caught her just in time but could have been worse. Sharing this just so you all can be careful with your stuff during your visit. Spain is a gorgeous country with some great people, and it is certainly worth going if you take a little care to ensure the safety of your belongings. I am guessing that Madrid and Barcelona are likely worse than any other Spanish city in this regard. We went to San Sebastian during the same trip as well and it had seemed like the safest place.

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MD_scubanut
Reviews.Content: Husa Paseo del Arte is situated in a great location and easily within walking distance of the Museo del Prado, the botanical gardens, the Cecilio Rodriguez gardens, Frog Market and the Atocha train station. We like to walk a lot when we travel, so walking to Puerta del Sol, the Royal Palace, Salamanca, and many other Madrid attractions was very easy from this starting point. The rooms are very clean although I found some of them to be a tad on the small side, so I would not recommend more than two people per room. The bed itself was more like a double, but we learned that there are rooms with king size beds because we had to change rooms on our final night due to a problem with the air conditioning. Unfortunately, the room with the larger bed also overlooked the street and there was also some traffic noise, but it was a tolerable level on the 4th floor. Husa Paseo del Arte offers a very nice buffet breakfast complete with eggs, bacon, breads, luncheon meat, fruit, pastries, juices, coffee and even wine. Smoked salmon was available on some days. It was undoubtedly the best breakfast buffet we experienced in Spain. My only complaint about this hotel is they charge extra for WiFi access (6 Euro per hour) unless you pay for a Superior room, where it is included in the price. Even some two star hotels we stayed at offered free WiFi. English language television is rather limited as well, but this seems to be a common theme in Spain. The NBC Evening News was available on CNBC at 12:30 AM, but there was no volume on this channel so CNN, BBC and one other network were broadcast in English. There were about 4 channels in English. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Husa Paseo del Arte and I would recommend it for anyone who wants to visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: mxktulu
Reviews.Content: We booked this through a great deal on Expedia... for the price it was brilliant in fact I would have paid 25% over a booking price for the quality. The staff were well trained. The room was spotlessly clean. Its possible to be in bit more central locations however the links are not bad. The hop on hop off tourist bus stops around the corner and major train and bus station is a ten minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: londontumbleweed
Reviews.Content: The wife and I had a stop-over in Madrid en route to Sevilla. This is a decent business hotel that is near the Atoche Train station. Very handy if you have an early train to catch out of Madrid Atoche.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Elena F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near Atocha station, that made it ideal for day trips out of Madrid. We took a bus from airport to Atocha station, so the "traveling' part of our trip was relaxed, convenient and uneventful. The hotel itself is clean, modern and safe. Front desk usually is staffed with more than one person so finding an English speaking help was not a problem. We arrived at 11 am and were offered a room right away, even though an official check-in is 3 pm and the front desk was very busy. They also held our luggage for us after we checked out. Despite being on a busy street the rooms were pretty quiet. We had no problem sleeping in late. The only issue I had with this hotel is is a lack of free wi-fi even in the lobby. I still had to pay 12 euros a day for a wi-fi even in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Paseo Del Arte”
Reviews.Author: ScotsBloke
Reviews.Content: this hotel is excellently located, just a walk away from most places in central Madrid. We were bowled over by how interesting Madrid was and fail to understand why so many people choose to go to characterless beach resorts in Spain when cities like this exist. What a great night we had in the Plaza Mayor as an impromptu jazz band started playing and a little old lady started dancing. within 15 minutes there were numerous people dancing with her.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Mark T
Reviews.Content: A business type hotel (which I like). Great value, clean and modern. Great location. Walk (with big luggage) to Atocha station, Prado, Queen Sophia Gallery. The staff were generally very friendly and helpful with exception of the Manager who seemed uncooperative. Do not expect to get early arrival if your flight lands in early morning as most internationals do. We had to wait until past 4pm for rooms after arriving at hotel at 10am.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: RAT_27
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Husa Paseo del Arte for one night because it was our last night in Spain before flying out of Madrid, and this stay perfectly bookended our time in Madrid with two great hotels. The hotel is located in close proximity to the Renfe Atocha Station, the underground metro, the large parklands, and a number of museums and art galleries. There are also a heap of bars, cafes and restaurants within metres of the hotel. The staff were very helpful, and the stay was without hassle. The hotel has a gm on the top level, and while it is fairly basic, it has a number of equipment for use with a nice view out over the Madrid skyline. We enjoyed a few drinks at the lobby bar, as well as breakfast and dinner at the restaurant. The dinner was one of the best (no-tapas) meals we enjoyed in our whole time in Spain... very nice! We had to pay for wifi, which is probably a little expensive for given you're not really going to be using it for the full 24 hours. But don't let that stop you from enjoying this great hotel. We'd definitely consider staying here the next time we were to visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Ch1025
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern hotel very central and comfortable. Affordable and a good place to stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Generic, fair value hotel near the train”
Reviews.Author: enjoy_period60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Husa Paseo del Arte Hotel for one night this June. The hotel is a big, corporate-y, generic place, but the location is great. VERY close to Retiro park and a 5 minute walk from the RENFE Atocha train station, the hotel was a great starting-off point for touring Madrid and arriving/departing by train and/or airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean air conditioned hotel in very good position near to several art galleries, bus stops, station etc. Staff helpful. Comfy beds. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JustAddEggs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, the staff friendly, the location perfect. We were able to walk to almost anywhere we wanted to go. We stayed in room 601 which was perfect as it faced the side street, so no noise, which is important on the weekend as there are 2 nightclubs down the street and it can get quite noisy until the wee hours of the morning. I know many people have mentioned coffee makers would be nice, but my suggestion is to go out and enjoy the streets and have your coffee there. There is a McDonald's and a Starbucks right in front of you. The hotel is also in walking distance from the Train Station which makes it ideal if you plan on going elsewhere in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Rooms are a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: tringuyen82
Reviews.Content: After being move to a different room (with some discussion with management) - I thought the executive level rooms with the balconies were fantastic. Now I stayed in March, but I figured the room change was worth the comment. I had a great view of the city... the location is quite good, however requires a walk to the city center, but perfect for museums. We took the bus in from the airport, attocha stop (?) it was the LAST stop on the bus route, ending at the bus station and we were in 5-10 min walking distance to the hotel. DO ASK the friendly tourist info desk for directions. They spoke english very well and directed us to use the bus as oppose to the metro... which is easy as well, but requires several changes. The room was quite spacious... large bathroom. Modern... just as nice as the more famous chain of hotels (owned by a socialite's father). Coffee and tea in room, clean beddings. Plus... its near a fancy european McD's. Management in the end did a good job and I wanted to come back and comment.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel, close to train station”
Reviews.Author: alisont2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with a friend for 3 nights in september. This is a clean, modern hotel, situated so close to the train station Atocha. Less than 5 minutes walk away, it was so handy not having to lugg your suitcase too far. We didnt pay to have breakfast here as reading other reviews it says it is cheaper to have breakfast out at nearby cafes. Unfortunately we didnt like the food at Madrid, their breakfasts dont measure up to a full english!! We werent too keen on the tapas either! Sorry! The rooms are clean and modern with a mini bar and we had quite a good nights sleep every night as it wasnt too noisy.We would stay here again as its in a great location for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: Cakelover_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for long weekend - great hotel but never before woken up by traffic jam outside at 5am! Despite double glazing you could still hear it on the Sun morning! Good location for the museums but not many places to eat nearby in the evenings so have to go into the centre really. We didn't have breakfast included but could recommend the little cafe bar directly opposite the hotel on the corner

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mimigidget
Reviews.Content: Excellent location across from the Atocha train station/metro. The staff were very helpful, offering sight seeing tips. Room was very comfortable and always clean, maids very attentive. Didn't have a problem with the noise from the Disco next door. Breakfast was very nice. All in all, excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not totally satisfied”
Reviews.Author: cadeco
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a few steps away from the Atocha station, so it is very easy to reach the city centre on foot (just 10-15 min) from here. Metro just around the corner. We were a little disappointed at our arrival, the guy at the reception was pretty aseptic and bored, he also gave us the wrong room with respect to what we asked at the reservation. This is a pity, because this is the first sensation you have of the hotel and, even if the other receptionists were nice, we have this bad memory... Our room was nice, spacious and clean. It was on the main road so quite noisy in the morning, but with a good light. Bathroom was really spacious and comfortable! We hadn't breakfast here, so we cannot judge. Again, the wifi was not free, but with a high fee (for example 4 euro for 30 minutes). I think this is a bad idea...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DKWlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right across from the Atocha train station. Travelling anywhere from the stop was very convenient. The hotel is very close to the the museums and Retiro Park. I didn't realize how close we were to the museums until the final part of our trip. If you are looking for night life or shopping, this isn't the spot. There is a club and a Flamenco spot very close to the hotel, but the Flamenco place was expensive (to me) and too many teenagers were waiting outside the club one night. I don't like to be near the touristy areas when I travel, so this was a great combo of proximity to museums and away from loud club areas. Skip breakfast. It's just way too expensive for what you get. You're better off going to the Mueso del Hamon. It's decent food and cheap. My other issue was the bed(s). Instead of just one nice queen or king sized bed, there are two twin beds pushed together. We got over this very quickly, but it was annoying at times. I guess this is a common European hotel thing. Not a fan. I really like the hotel. It was clean and wonderful customer service. If you don't want to pay for internet, and you shouldn't, just go to McDonald's. Free wi-fi there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: abcfox
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, near all major museums, metro and train station. Large, comfortable room, very comfortable bed. Staff helpful and accommodating, even let us use the computer briefly to print boarding passes at no charge. Breakfast overpriced, but interesting food, maybe worth trying once if you are there for a few days. We had no problems with noise. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A good value, but be careful about the room's location if you are bothered by noise.”
Reviews.Author: Wilhelmina87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of April and for 5 nights early in May. Overall, it is a good value. It is located very close to the Atocha railway station and the Reina Sofia museum. The Prado and the Botanical Garden are also quite nearby. The hotel itself is modern and the staff is helpful and courteous. They are also able to communicate well enough in English. It is possible to have a nice meal in the bar area in the lobby outside the traditional Spanish meal times. There are a number of eating facilities with side walk cafes on a pleasant square just outside the Reina Sofia Museum. Even though I requested a quiet room, I was initially given a room on the 4th floor overlooking a narrow street where around 11 pm. a large number of people gathered waiting to enter a nearby night club. The noise generated by this crowd kept me awake till about 2:30 am. even with the windows closed. The following morning, I requested another room and was I switched to a room on the side of the patio, which solved the problem. Another drawback was the breakfast which is nice and elaborate, but quite overpriced at approximately 18 euros. There was no free access to a computer, and the charge was 6 euros per hour to use a computer, which provided no privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location for Atocha, the larger galleries and Retiro Park”
Reviews.Author: Tom L
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were visiting Madrid together after having been before (she lived there for a year). The location was okay as we had planned to take a trip out to Toledo one day and it's very close (5 minutes walk) from Atocha station. However, there are plenty of places closer to better areas for shopping, eating, nightlife, etc. The room was a decent size and it was clean, everything seemed to work fine. Even though we were very close (next door?) to a late night club (Kapital), the sound never bothered us our room on the fifth floor. We didn't use the bar, the restautant nor make much use of the staff but all looked on the face of it nice enough. The reason it only gets three stars is because there are better locations in the city to stay and because there is nothing special about the hotel, it is just a clean, reasonably priced stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: CustomerConsultant
Reviews.Content: They quoted a price to park in writing ... and then charged me more than quoted. Their mistake they told me but I was still expected to pay the extra. Do they really expect me to recommend them after that poor customer service experience?

Reviews.Title: “O.K. if you need to be near Atocha train station”
Reviews.Author: bellemex
Reviews.Content: Not too bad but nothing special, the rooms are nice, clean and the closeness to Atocha and Paseo del Prado is very convenient. We got a very good rate through Expedia booking far in advance. Most of the floors are non-smoking however our first room smelled like tobacco, but they moved us to another room. All rooms have a ashtrays (?). The staff is indifferent not very friendly. I would avoid walking down called Atocha past the hotel, there is nothing good to see, there are some dirty ugly stores, restaurants. It does feel very safe though. The McDonalds is just a few steps away. A great place to use your computer with their free McWi-Fi, since the hotel doesn’t offer free wi-fi or free computer use. This is 2012 for crying out loud. We walked to Atocha to catch the Airport Express to the airport for 2E, an affordable and very nice option. Not very many people use it.

Reviews.Title: “Plush, luxurious modern hotel over the road from Atocha train station.”
Reviews.Author: NightOwl34
Reviews.Content: Usually hotels near train stations are older and less well-appointed than their more glamorous cousins in the city centre. I picked this hotel for our final night in Madrid, so we’d be close to the airport bus leaving from Atocha station next day. (And it really is close – it takes about 5 minutes to walk, including waiting to cross the busy road). On entering the hotel, I was pleasantly surprised how luxurious it was – this is a top-end hotel, yet still close to the train station. The rooms were large, with a huge bed and an equally massive bathroom, fitted out in glistening marble. As well as room to swing a cat, there's enough room to swing a dog and a small pony if you have one with you. All the usual facilities were there if you wanted them – room safe, telephone, big TV, lifts, restaurant, bar, excellent service from multi-lingual staff. They even let us check-in slightly earlier, and check out an hour later with no hassle and no extra fees. The hotel is obviously popular with foreign tourists, and is about 2 minute’s walk from the Reine Sofia art gallery, which is handy if you wish to visit during the free evening sessions. (Be warned there is a considerable queue for these, we paid to go earlier and avoid the queues.) There are also several restaurants between the hotel and the gallery, which don’t look too fancy (strip lighting, big TV, people smoking at the bar) but actually serve good food – check out the number of locals eating here after the gallery closes, if you want further proof! The beautiful Buen Retiro park is also just a few minutes' walk away - perfect for a stroll in the morning, before heading to the airport in the afternoon. And finally, pop into Atocha station for a look around, even if you don't have a train or a bus to catch. The main building has been turned into a hothouse for tropical plants, and has terrapins swimming around a pond at their base. It's quite a sight. A great hotel, at a good price

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Woz1964
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and it was great. Lovely rooms. The staff were great!!! I lost my phone and they let me use their computer and phone to sort it all out. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ROBCIS22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Husa Paseo de los Artes. Hotel is well located for transportation as it around the corner from the Atocha station of the Madrid Metro. The express airport bus has its first and last stop at the station and is only two euros vs. 25-30 euros for cab to airport. Also very close to Reina Sophia Museum and Botannical Gardens as well as other landmarks and museums. Hotel was clean and continental breakfast was included, but beds were small by American standards. A double room means to twin mattresses are put together. Recommend Plaza Major with its cafes for tapas and jamon iberico. Metro in Madrid is an inexpensive and safe way to get around. Finally, hotel charges for internet go to McDonalds at corner for free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location ! Near museums and train station”
Reviews.Author: soyviajero
Reviews.Content: We were just in Madrid overnight, coming from Seville by train, and our priority was to see the art museums. This is a great location. Walk to it from Atocha train station... And from the hotel the Prado, Reina Sofia, and Thyssen museums are easily accessible. Our room was not quite ready , so we had a very nice lunch in the hotel restaurant. modern room looking out on the Calle de Atocha. Very well-equipped bathroom. I was a little disappointed that the wifi was not free, but overall this is a very good hotel, friendly staff, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good, efficient, well located, business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fatherof1
Reviews.Content: Our group of two couples picked this central hotel for our weekend city break. We arrived from the airport via the Metro, changing three lines en route, to Atocha, about 100m away. Adjacent to busy main roads, near the Sofia and Prado museums, both only a walk away. The hotel is modern with fresh decor; two basement car parking levels, a gym (no time to try it) and a ground floor restaurant. The reception staff managed to understand our spoken english and quickly relocated us to two different rooms when we expressed concern about the possible noise from Madrid's biggest nightclub just next door. Our rooms on the fourth floor were clean, offering a pair of joined twin, firm beds. The bathroom only had a large walk-in shower, was well lit and functioned perfectly. The breakfast in the restaurant, available until 11.00 hrs, offered a good range of hot and cold food, typical of the larger European hotel style. The fresh fruit was disappointing, it all seemed past its best.There were five different coffees and four different teas, but sadly, no boiling water for the tea, only 'hot' water from the coffee machine. A well located, functional hotel, good at the price. We were not at all disturbed by the night life.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing and Trustworthy”
Reviews.Author: Danett
Reviews.Content: These days, despite the internet and advances in information technology, traveling is still the pursue of the unknown!! When searching for an hotel, you check the pictures and so on, but you really don't know what you gonna get!! In a group trip I was in charge of finding the hotel in Madrid, because I speak fluently Portuguese and if you do so, you almost understand all Spanish. When we arrived, the entire group, but particularly me, was pleased because my judgment and decision making process matched accurately with the reality I found at Husa Paseo Del Arte. Yeah, this hotel is good, I felt really well every time I returned to my room!! The architecture, decoration, cleaning, amenities, were all good. I cannot talk about food because we took our meals in the nearby restaurants (which are so many)!! My only complaint is about the internet connection. Maybe because of my room location, I couldn't get the wi-fi signal, so I got my money back! This was not a big deal to me because I was connected all day at the Congress venue, and I could skype my family on a daily basis!! One other thing I noticed, was the way the people talked to the customers at the reception. The day we arrived, there was a charming old man (which even spoke some Japanese) that was very friendly!! But the others I found the other days talked in a "cold face" mode. No smiles!! It was like giving commands to somebody or give and take orders - like in the army!! I found the same behavior with the waiters in the nearby restaurants!! No "emotion" dropped in the process!! So maybe, it is a cultural trait (of the Spanish people) and that is the "correct approach" they find when dealing with customers!! In fact, it may be!! The things we find "correct", "ethical" and so on, have to be understood at the "local level"!! By that, I mean that all these issues are "relative" and they certainly vary from place to place!! I live now for more than half a decade in Japan and I travel extensively, both locally and throughout the world, due to my research work. So, when I apply my "sociological and anthropological eye" (I have a sharp one, hehe, but this is not the field of my work) I do it very carefully!! When we judge others, we do it based on "our standards"!! But they may not be theirs!! I wish I could stay longer in Madrid to mature this view, but the busy week I spent there last summer is enough to give the accurate picture I'm giving here about this Hotel to prospective customers. You will not get disappointed with this choice!! And I have nothing to do with this institution!!

Reviews.Title: “Location ... Location .. Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SBV7
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location, the best breakfast in Madrid for this kind of hotel. Small Rooms but well furnished and very clean. Right price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good stay”
Reviews.Author: RenatoLoaiza
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my wife and we liked this hotel a lot. Is very well located in principal places in Madrid. You can go anywhere from here. The hotel itself is clean, organised and modern. Very good choice for your trips to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Madrid Spring”
Reviews.Author: Galloglaigh2
Reviews.Content: Arriving in a grey wet Madrid spring day, our initial thought we had picked the wrong location. Never having been to Madrid before we looked for a location near to the Atocha station where the Airport bus terminates. Since it was early afternoon, the shutters were down and the extensive graffiti could be seen everywhere. Wrong end of town we thought. The hotel is a pleasant business class one part of a chain. The reception was efficient and dealt with our poor spanish very well. The room was modern, clean and perhaps small to non-Europeans. After unpacking we hit the streets and headed up to the Plaza Major where the Tourist Information have inexpensive (3.9 Euros) walking tours. The one thing the guide said was to loose the street map and explore - which we did. Turns out our location was one of the best. A short distance away is the Reina Sofia gallery. Slightly further the Prado. The immediate area (Cortes) has some fantastic side streets such as Calle de las Huertas which come alive after 6:00 pm and are very safe to walk around or sit watching the locals pass by. Our favourite was the Retiro park where families spend the weekend on bikes, skateboards, roller blades or exercise. In looking back it was the right decision to get a quality hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and fresh”
Reviews.Author: tripperhov
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three times. The hotel is a 3 minute walk from Atocha railway station, so it’s quick for trains to N. Ministerios then the metro to the airport. The centre of town is a 10 minutes’ walk away. I’ve had 2 internal facing rooms and one road facing room. I’ve not found the internal rooms noisy, in fact the opposite – blissfully quiet - but I did not stay in the internal facing rooms over a weekend so I can’t advise how much noise weekend partying may create. The rooms were modern and comfortable with modern bathrooms. The bed was comfortable, the room equipped with a flat screen TV, fridge, internet (extra charge) and an electronic safe, fitted out in a modern contemporary style. I managed to reserve the wheel chair rooms as they are spacious (huge!) in comparison to the double rooms, which themselves are a standard size. I’ve never had breakfast here as it is expensive. There are plenty of cafes within a 2 minute walk where you can get breakfast for €6 – Musea de Jamon for instance. If you’re on a weekend break then take a walk up to Plaza Mayor for a nice breakfast while watching the world go by. Overall a nice hotel, but a bit pricy on the breakfast side. For me this hotel just pips the NH Nacional to the post as it's more modern and has a fresher feel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploration in the heart of Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Onwi03
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic modern hotel in the heart of Madrid. It's very easy to get to from the airport. Once you exit the terminal look for the Aeropuerto Express Bus making its rounds. There's a tall skinny plastic pillar smack dab where it stops and that also has the bus timetable written on it. There are only three stops. To get to the hotel stay on until the last stop, Atocha Station. Look for the roundabout and a McDonalds across the way. The hotel is just down the street from the golden arches and past some sort of all ages night club. I google street viewed the hotel earlier and was able to recognize it right away. We loved the location for its easy access to old Madrid. You're across the street from the Reina Sofia and a short walk from the Prado. During our stay we walked to the Prado and bought passes for a Madrid City Tours hop-on and off bus and were able to cover the majority of sights quickly and easily. Never had to use the subway. We also were able to walk all the way to the Royal Palace and back easily. The proximity of the hotel to the main sights made it easy to duck back into our room for a siesta or bathroom break in the middle of the day. The hotel room was fantastic. We had a nice view of the courtyard so never really heard any traffic or city noise. It was clean and spacious. No carpet which is a big plus in my book... sorry carpet lovers. We absolutely looked forward to coming back to our room at the end of each long day of exploring. It was also in proximity to plenty of restaurants and shops so there was always something nearby. My only gripe is that wi-fi is not free. If you're lucky you can go to the McDonalds near the hotel which has "wi-fi gratis." I was able to connect a few times but the signal was pretty weak. I managed to send out a few iMessages in the brief time I had access but don't expect to be able to FaceTime or do an heavy browsing. If you want to get back to the airport the same bus that got you here can take you back... it only picks up at Atocha Station. Since we left at 4AM we opted for private transport to the Airport for 38 euros. According to a random taxi driver we spoke to it costs around 30 euros, "mas o menos," from the hotel. We left on a Sunday morning and there were still a good number of people out and about, either going home from a club or staggering about the street. Taxis were everywhere and abundant. Not sure how an early morning weekday would look though. Pretty sure we would have found a taxi but we just opted for the private driver. Overall, this hotel is the ideal place to stay for anyone wanting to visit Madrid. I'll definitely be back here if I'm ever in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great rooms very well priced”
Reviews.Author: Ljcremer
Reviews.Content: I did not know what to expect but was very impressed with the quality and service at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Can hardly go wrong with this choice”
Reviews.Author: TXMISS54
Reviews.Content: My review is essentially a reiteration of the other reviews: super convenient, central location; opposite or very near main attractions--reina sofia museum, prado, retiro park. Close to fast food places: McD's (for free wi-fi access),Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts--(but you didn't come to Madrid for those...) The Atocha underground station is directly across the street. We bought a five day pass for convenient, unlimited travel (including airport transfers) for 19€--a bargain. Busker entertainment in the underground is amusing, the transport is relatively clean and safe (though you still have to watch out for pickpockets wherever you go). The hotel is modern, tastefully decorated, nothing overdone. The rooms clean, tile fooring; mattresses (very) firm, (probably could have used an extra blanket the first night); good lighting in the room, though the reading lights were non-adjustable, so pretty useless--nice attempt, though; bathrooms super clean with lots of glass and tile, walk-in shower w/ lots of hot water, no tub. Bidets included. Fresh white towels that smell good. Little tchochkes that people like to stash in their bags (soap, combs, shoehorn, sewing kit, etc) are also included and replaced ever day.(I personally liked the mini ball point pens with the post-em note pads). No coffee machines in the room, but you can bring your coffee up from the bar downstairs. We stayed in room 434. The drawback to this room was the disco below--on Sat/Sun we had to close the window during the night it was so noisy till the wee hours...and the place to receive deliveries seems to be directly below, too. But this is a city, so what can one expect? The neighbors across the way can look directly into your room if you don't draw the curtains, but you can look at them (and their laundry) too and see how the Madrileinos live... The staff was okay. You had to wait to get the women's attention at reception. (Generally you don't have to wait to get any man's attention in Madrid if you're blond...) The staff in the breakfast room polite. The cleaning lady super sweet--leave her a tip! The place was well staffed during late night hours, too, and always felt like a safe place to be at any hour. Breakfast was a real smorgasbord--really good, fresh edibles, hot and cold, Nestle coffee machines, everything nicely arranged and never looking as if the food had been out too long. Beware though--it's a pricey treat if you have to pay extra for it and did not include it in your package deal. Places we'd recommend: a little bar called Malaspina (drink the Ramon Bilbao crianza!), the Villa Rosa bar for the late Flamenco show, and the restaurants on the Santa Ana Plaza for tapas. The Rastro flea market is only open on Sundays. And be sure to use the audio tour thingies to go tour the palace and the Prado. Do not go into any place that employs someone to drag you in there. There's a reason that they have to get someone out there to pull people in...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Wrighty0
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 3 night stay here. The hotel is located a couple of minutes walk from the metro which is about 45 mins from the airport and really easy and cheap to use. The hotel is modern and the rooms are a good size with fresh towels and clean sheets everyday. The reception and concierge staff were very friendly and helpful with recommendations and directions. The beautiful park with boating lake, botanic gardens and the Reina Sofia Gallery are all within very close walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: Kathalpet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. Walking distance to the airport bus,train station, metro, important museums and has good bus links to the rest of the city. Hop -on hop -off bus stop round corner. Breakfast is excellent. We are non-meat and shellfish eaters and the restaurant did not offer good choices. We had a fish meal one evening in the bar area which was excellent. Room was comfortable only down sides - no tea/coffee facilities and the location ( by the side of the night club) - therefore noisy on Friday and Saturday night. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Convienient Choice - Above Average”
Reviews.Author: hmurch
Reviews.Content: Above average hotel, provides good value for the cost. It is a 10-minute walk to the Museo Del Prado. The Reina Sofia Museum is literally across the street. Good restaurants within short walk. Exercise room adequate. Internet access is awkward and cost is 6 Euros per half-hour. Hotel restaurant average and costly. Neighborhood offers better value.

Reviews.Title: “Central location for this lovely arte Hotel, Hola Madrid”
Reviews.Author: runwaygirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights over the weekend with a friend in a twin room. The hotel is conveniently located in the centre of Madrid in the art distict right next to the Reina Sofia museum. The metro is very close 3 mins from the door ' Atocha' and also Atocha Renfe Main line station is opposite for trips to Toledo and other parts of spain, which I did and highly recommend. The Hotel has a very modern look with desirable furniture and a lovely bar in the entrance, the rooms have a wardrobe for storage, comfortable bed, flat screen tv and fridge/minibar. Large bathroom, fresh towels everyday and hot water....no complaints at all. Wifi is avaliable at a price per hour or day avaliable from reception as well as currency exchange which was helpful. I didnt have breakfast or dinner in the restaurant so cannot comment but I always saw it as busy. There are cafes/restaurants close by and a well know coffee shop not far for those who need that breakfast fix and catch up on the emails. Overall had an excellent stay at this hotel, the price was very good and I would stay here again straight away. The staff were only too happy to help me with anything and spoke good english.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, correct... but not enough for 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: DAVID_ESCALDES_1979
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. There's no doubt that if you gonna move into the art center in Madrid, you can go walking everywhere. But, can you belive in a 4 stars hotel there's no room service after 11 PM? And, what about the TV chanels, not enaugh again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Nazim S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good. Very well located in the center. Not far from 3 biggest museums. But... A little bit noisy because of a disco club nearby. Room are cold - bad isolation of windoows in Junior suite. Breakfast is not variable.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and convenient hotel makes for a great city break”
Reviews.Author: gentryman
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for two nights for our second trip to Madrid. Our double room on the fifth floor was cosy enough, with a good sized, well-equipped bathroom - the free shoehorn was a nice touch. Very clean and nicely furnished. Probably the best thing about it is its location; although Madrid is an extremely accessible city anyway (the most efficient and cheap Metro service I've ever come across), the Husa Paseo del Arte is well within walking distance of Atocha station, the best art galleries in the city and the Retiro, a spacious and handsome park that is perfect for strolls no matter what the season. These attractions are all within Madrid's Bourbon quarter, arguably the most beautiful part of the city. Fountains abound, and the wide boulevards are a pleasant change from the narrow labyrinthine layout of the old centre and La Castellana in the north of the city. In all honesty we didn't spend much time in the hotel, what with all the fun times to be had exploring Madrid. However, as a relatively inexpensive, convenient and comfortable base for sleeping and showering, the Husa is perfect. Staff at reception are efficient and more than happy to look after your bags after you've checked out if, like us, you had a few hours spare before your flight home. We would recommend transit to and from Barajas airport via the Aeropuerto Exprés shuttle bus service - this only has three stops in the city, the third being Atocha station, which is handy in the extreme. It is probably about as quick as a taxi and most importantly, much cheaper at 2 euros. The only negatives I can think of are the hotel bar, which is ludicrously overpriced, and the hotel's proximity to a nightclub slightly down the road which is open from 12am to 6am - early morning revellers could just about be heard on the street below, but this would probably only affect the lightest of sleepers. All in all though, a great stay and very much recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location, okay service”
Reviews.Author: PradaLuggage
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Husa Paseo del Arte for 3 nights. The location of the hotel is near the Atocha train station and right next to the Reina Sofia. We arrived at Madrid airport and took the 2 euro Airport express bus from the airport to Atocha station. You can just pay the driver when you get on (stops at every terminal) and Atocha is the last stop). At Atocha station, you turn left once you get off the bus and walk up the street about 5 minutes to the plaza. The hotel is just up Calle Atocha (look for the McDonald's on the corner). The hotel is modern and the rooms very clean. While not large, they were a good size compared with other European hotels. Our only complaint with the room itself was the lack of electrical outlets. We could only find one in our entire room. Service at the hotel was so so. No one was super friendly. Also, as other reviewers have said, sound was an issue. This was similar to what we have experienced at other European hotels. The hotel does not have free wifi but you can just go to the Starbucks or McDonald's next to the hotel for wifi. The Starbucks is right outside the Reina Sofia and has fresh squeezed orange juice (turn left out of the hotel and take a right at the first light down the small street on the side). You have to ask for a wifi password when you order. We were able to walk to most attractions from the hotel. The Prado is just up the next street, Retiro Park is also very close. We also walked to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real. The Atocha metro station is also very close. We ate at Miau in Plaza Santa Ana, which had good croquettes, grilled vegetables and Spanish omelet. We tried Daruno across the street and the food was not very good (we got shrimp and paella), service was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel near Paseo del Prado and Atocha”
Reviews.Author: vanjacobson
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel for just one night but it was nice enough to notice this is a modern, comfortable and well-located hotel option in Madrid. Good night of sleep in a clean room, good bathroom and a well-trained staff. The day after our staying we took our luggage and walk 100 meters to reach Atocha train station. Excellent deal. We would definitely come back and stay a little longer in our next visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “una habitacion de 5*”
Reviews.Author: david2311
Reviews.Content: Estuve alojado con mi mujer y mis dos hijos (2 y 8 años), dos noches, del 28 al 30 de diciembre pasado. Fue extraordinario. 1.- check-in: llegamos de valencia con el AVE a las 10:48 a Atocha, y a las 11:05 ya estábamos haciendo el check-in. fue muy rápido. había 3 personas atendiendo en ese momento y nos facilitaron una de las 2 habitaciones comunicadas que teníamos reservadas que ya estaba lista a esa hora de la mañana. 2.- habitaciones: la habitación grande, 621, hace toda la esquina del edificio recayente a la estación. la vista es estupenda, y las dimensiones de escándalo. no bromeo cuando la califico como una habitación de 5* en un hotel de 4. la cama es enorme y comodísima, tiene un sofa de 3 plazas muy grande y un butacón (muy mullidos ambos), y además en el otro extremo de la habitación, un escritorio muy amplio. el cuarto de baño es también muy amplio y está muy bien decorado (como el resto de la habitación), y dispone de todas las amenities. ni en esa habitación ni en la otra se oía ningún ruido molesto de la calle que nos impidiera dormir ninguna de las dos noches que estuvimos (miércoles y jueves). cuando salimos a pasear por madrid tras haber descargado las maletas descubrí que la 6ª planta era de fumadores. entonces recordé haber leído algún comentario al respecto. les he de indicar que mi hija es asmática (no podemos acceder a locales de fumadores por prescripción médica), y no percibimos ningún olor a tabaconi en la planta ni mucho menos en las habitaciones. nos habrían tenido que cambiar de habitación por este hecho. la habitación grande compartía una puerta exterior común con la pequeña donde nos cabía el carrito del bebé. esta habitación estaba también muy bien, aunque no tenía las dimensiones de la otra. era imposible correr por ella. pero todo estaba en perfecto estado y también muy bien decorada. 3.- limpieza de las habitaciones: las 2 habitaciones estaban impecables. el chupete de mi hijo que no había manera de encontrarlo lo encontró la chica de la limpieza. muy servicial. el 2º día al verla por la mañana a las 11 le dije que ya podía limpiar la habitación pequeña (620), pero mis hijos jugando dejaron en la puerta el cartel de "no molestar". el resultado fue que llegamos a las 21:15 y la habitación estaba sin hacer. llamé por teléfono a conserjería y a las 21:45 (mientras cenábamos en el restaurante), nos arreglaron la habitación sin nigún problema. al día siguiente la chica nos pidió excusas, y yo le dije que si estaba el cartel que debía estar tranquila. 4.- gimnasio: está en la última plantay se disfruta desde alli de unas vistas inmejorables. perfectamente equipado y con una dimensiones apreciables. tiene aparatos muy modernos de todos los modelos y el suelo de parquet. yo diría que 12/15 aparatos: 2 cintas de correr, remos, bicicletas estáticas, pesas, espalderas,.... está muy bien y a su lado está el solarium con unas hamacas muy cómodas 5.- desayuno: salón bastante amplio. el café es de máquina de nespresso (pero menuda máquina más grande, ya la quisiera yo en mi casa). de caliente hay revuelto de tortilla, bacon y longanizas. fiambres y quesos diversos, también frutos secos y cereales . una amplia variedad de fruta pelada y ensaladas. y en cuanto al dulce, hay yogures, mermeladas, nutella, mantequilla, pan de diversos tipos, para hacer tostadas y una amplia variedad de tartas. la bollería buenísima, sobre todo los croissants que están rellenos de crema, la tarta de santiago y la de manzana muy buenas también. 4 o 5 sabores diferentes de zumos. o sea que si desayunas fuerte, puedes aguantar hasta casi la merienda. acaba a las 10:30, que empiezan a recoger las bandejas. 6.- cena: quisimos cenar una noche en el restaurante para probar. está todo exquisito. probamos la dorada, las carrilleras, las minihamburguesas de ternera y unas patatas rellenas. todo servido en platos enormes. el pan se podía escoger entre diversas variedades: yo escogí el de queso que estaba muy bueno y mi mujer el de aceitunas. los postres que tomamos fueron crema catalana y una seleccion de pasteles. todo genial. en cuanto al precio no sé si fue demasiado caro porque no tengo referencias de los precios en madrid de este tipo de restaurantes, pero la calidad era excepcional. no me pareció un atraco a mano armada. 7.- para nosotros es la tercera ocasión que nos alojamos en este hotel y lo hemos encontrado mejor que la vez anterior que fue hace 3 años (julio/agosto de 2008). evidentemente, la próxima vez que volvamos a madrid no tendremos ningun género de duda en repetir. es una magnífica elección para quien viaja en tren desde Atocha. records

Reviews.Title: “bad sleep in a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michel99
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel. We booked an executive room with a balcony and were upgraded to a club room without balcony but 40 sqm with free minibar. Good deal! Breakfast is very nice but the people who serve it are less nice. The noice in the rooms facing the street is terrible. I stayed on the 7th floor and still a lot of noice. This in combination of the gym which was on top of our room, forced us to wear ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mommabean
Reviews.Content: What started out questionable, ended up as a great stay. We spent 5 nights here beginning Oct 28, 2011. I selected an executive room based on pictures I saw here at trip advisor. The room we were first given was no where close to what we expected. It was very tiny. We don't do well in tiny rooms as we tend to get in each other's way and there is no place to leave more than one open suitcase. We went down to the front desk and I explained what we had been expecting. They were exceptionally nice and told me an executive room with the 2 sinks in the bathroom, which I had expected, would be ready a little bit later if I'd like to leave my luggage with them. They said the room would be about the same size though. We opted to wait. And we were glad we did. We were pleasantly surprised by a room with much more floor space so we wouldn't be tripping over each other. The bathroom was much larger and more spacious over all other than just having 2 sinks. Most people wouldn't like the view from this room as much as the other room but we loved it since we could see the trees in the botanical garden and the wall of plants from a distance - a wall people like to visit and take pictures. All the large balconies were equally nice. The wifi worked great although it required log in every time we returned to the hotel. It was included in our package. We are walkers so we didn't find the walk to the old historic area to be at all difficult. At first I had wished we had stayed in the other area but in the end I was glad we stayed here. We were near the museums which were great fun and so interesting. And I always thought I wasn't a museum person. We walked to the train station pulling our own luggage and caught the high speed train to Malaga when we left this fun and beautiful city. It was an easy walk for us. Our room was perfectly clean and very stylish in a modern way. I'd definitely stay here again. I'd hope for a larger room but I'd accept a smaller room now that I know this could happen. Everything else makes up for it. I only wish they had hair conditioner with the nice toiletries they left in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “very nice for a big hotel”
Reviews.Author: Supermensch
Reviews.Content: I tend to like smaller or boutique hotels, but this property is very well maintained and nicely appointed. The location is perfect - only a few steps from the Metro, 5 minutes from the high speed train station, and not 10 minutes to the Prado museum. The staff was friendly, and the lobby area is nice and spacious with numerous sitting areas to meet people or just sit and read. The rooms are clean, feel quite new, and are pretty. The bed was quite comfortable and the bathroom was roomy and very clean. The breakfast had a good variety of usual options as well as a little salad bar. There are lots of restaurants in the area, and it's an easy walk to a variety of shopping areas. Overall a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: csm168
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my husband who was there for business. The hotel staff was friendly and the rooms were very clean, but not luxurious. Great location across the street from the Riena Sofia and down the street from the Prado. Metro stop just around the corner and within walking distance to the Plaza Mayor, Puerto del Sol and Las Latinas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Central and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KahChin
Reviews.Content: Location location location. This hotel is very centrally located, within 2 minutes walking distance to a metro station, 10 minutes to the Atocha train station and within walking distance to the key museums, shopping and the botanical gardens. The hotel lobby appeared to have been refurbished recently and the rooms seem fairly new and clean. The rooms may be small but they made up in terms of the concealed storage places and a decent sized bathroom with power-shower. The place is very clean, modern and tastefully decorated. The only down side is that they do not have tea and coffee making facilities in the room and guests will have to ring up room service just to get hot water to make tea. Given that this is Madrid, I supposed most travellers will be drinking in clubs and tapas bars until the wee hours. There are 2 fairly popular night clubs just 2 doors away from the hotel, so remember to ask for a room further from the clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat - right across from Reina Sofia”
Reviews.Author: stooksk
Reviews.Content: We had room 514 on Calle Atocha with a view over the street and Reina Sofia. The room was quite spacious and appointed with nice contemporary furnishings. The floor was faux wood. The beds were two firm twins together. There was a small TV with a few English channels (mainly news). The bathroom was large, particularly by Euro standards with a full tub/shower, toilet and bidet. Dove crème wash is provided in the tub and by the sink. We had two small room issues… the A/C didn’t seem to have much output (which was OK as the outside temps were 40-60F) and we used the bathroom glasses for sodas and I don’t think these were replaced until day 3 of 4. No big deal. Location couldn’t be beat – right across from Atocha train station (the airport express bus drops off here), across from the Reina Sofia, short distance to the Prado and a 15-20 min. uphill walk to the Plaza Mayor. The hotel is close to the Metro but we walked everywhere. The hotel charges for wi-fi, but there is a McDonald’s down the street and a Starbucks across the street by Reina Sofia with free wi-fi. Nice for downtime. The front desk staff was quite helpful with directions to get to the futbol stadium. We’d definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Beds, Nightclub Next Door!”
Reviews.Author: MJBostick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in October. The location is great, very close to Atocha Train and Metro Stations, and also conveniently close to big art museums. The rooms are modern and very clean. We were on the seventh floor which is a smoking floor, and I did not smell smoke at all. We had a nice patio with a table & chairs and lounge chair. The patio overlooked a Nightclub that is open until about 6am on Friday and Saturday nights...the roof of the club opens up, so it is a bit noisy, but fun. The beds were very comfortable, and the bathroom was spotless with great amenities. Buffet breakfast is good, but expensive - 18 Euros per person. Many of the nearby restaurants open late, so we did enjoy the buffet a couple of times. One small note...not very many of the staff speak English...so learn a little Spanish before you visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamieT8175
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights on holiday. It is in a great location - in the theatre district, close to the main park, Prado museum and metro. Hotel is clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “So that's why they call it a club room.”
Reviews.Author: William_Brennan
Reviews.Content: I stayed six nights in a Club room (a bit bigger than the standard and with free Wi-Fi and minbar). The hotel has a number of positives - it is, as everyone points out, very convenient for the three main art museums (not forgetting the excellent, and free, Caixa Forum); the cleaning, laundry and room service are highly efficient; and the breakfast's not bad. However, do not stay in a Club room if you value a good night's sleep. There is a good deal of traffic noise (although probably a little less than for the average midtown Manhattan hotel room) and the bottlebank outside your window is emptied each night either side of midnight. But the real problem is one of Madrid's more popular nightclubs which is right next door. It is open on Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights and the noise from customers milling around outside is quite extraordinary. Earplugs helped early in my stay but the risk of not hearing my alarm on the last day when I had an early flight home meant a completely sleepless night. The hotel charges its highest rates on the nights when the club is open ......

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: YOrr18
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, close to all three of the big museums and within a 5 minute walking distance of the train station, restaurants, and 15 minutes for others sites. The regular rooms were a little small, but very clean and nicely furnished. We stayed 3 nights in a regular room, but on our way back we stayed in a suite which was not that much more expensive but it was well worth it. Lots more room and much more comfortable with a very good sized bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: EKAUS
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a good place- close to the main train station, metro and a hop on/ off bus stop. Rooms are a good size and clean. Wifi is not free and quite expensive to use, as is usual of the 4/5 star hotels. Overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: mengbei
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very close to train station, metro and museums. room is nice and well equipted. Bathroom is spacious and clean. Rate is reasonable and staffs are friendly. There are plenty nice cafe and tapas bar just cross the street. And a mini supermarket is near too. So everything is pretty much within the walking distance for the first time tourists those just want to see museum and spend easy time in madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable location... but that's where the comfort ends”
Reviews.Author: Burzhui
Reviews.Content: The location is great, 2 minutes from museum Reina Sofia and 5 minutes away from Prado museum. across the street from the Train station (you don't hear the trains) Cons*: Beds are uncomfortable, very springy and our request for a king sized bed was met with two twin beds pushed together. [THIS IS NOT THE SAME THING!!!!] Pillows were extremely flat with no extra pillows to be found. Stayed here for 2 nights, got barely any rest. Staff was courteous and tried to be very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lax room controls”
Reviews.Author: Traveler90110
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff let a total stranger into my room in the middle of the night just because they said it was their room (and it wasn't). It was extremely disturbing to have a strange person enter my room abruptly late at night when I was in the room, but I am equally disturbed by the implications had I not been in the room or asleep when it happened. The hotel manager tried to justify the incident, then said he was sorry and hung up, which wasn't very comforting. It seems to me that either this hotel doesn't have procedures in place to determine that the people it is letting into rooms should actually have access to them, or it has procedures it fails to enforce. Would definately not recommend this hotel to singles, or anyone really. There are plenty of other options in Madrid to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Near the Train Station”
Reviews.Author: eweb101
Reviews.Content: This hotel was convenient for me since I wanted to catch a train after my stay ended; I could walk from the hotel to the station. The rooms were very nice, but had a few minor service problems with the hotel. -I paid 12 euros a day for Internet access. One of those days the internet was down for about 8 hours, but there was no way to get a refund for those 8 hours. Typical customer support nightmare, they blamed it on my computer, I blamed it on their DHCP server being down. -the non-smoking room really did smell like smoke. It even had an ashtray in it. -climate control didn't work very well. The room was always too hot.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster unless you like breathing smoke 24/7”
Reviews.Author: krs182
Reviews.Content: We really loved the hotel, location was not ideal but the hotel was above average. Then we went to our room which was a non smoking request. We instead got a smoking room, in a smoking floor with 2 double beds for my husband and I. Not ideal for 2 non smokers on their holiday. We asked for another room the first night, the guy said everything wad full, to later find out the hotel was not even close to being occupied. We walked to our room the second night and the smoke was so thick, we literally could not breathe in our room it was DISGUSTING!! We asked for another room and the guy kept saying no..... But another guy realized we would not stay in that condition so he gave us another room (thanks Alvardo) Otherwise my husband and. Were ready to head to another hotel. If you are european and don't mind smoke, it's great. If don't want to breathe in a cloud of smoke all night (literally) find another place, they really don't care!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Denpichardo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right in front of the train station in which you have direct access to buses and transport to airport. Also near the Museums: Reina Sofia, Prado and Thyseem. Next to the botanical gardens and walking distance from the beautiful Parque del Retiro. Close to metro station to get to the center (Sol ). If you want to be centric but away from the noisy streets of Sol for the night... this spot is for you! Rooms: super clean, roomy, cozy... comfort at it's max! two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Viajerosin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Husa Paseo del Arte for 2 nights. The rooms were as nice as they are shown in the pictures. They have a modern decoration, were clean and comfortable. The windows were sound proof and also has double curtains which helped to a great sleep. They offer a decent breakfast buffet, nothing extraordinary but overpriced (18 Euros). They have Wi-Fii which has a fee based on minutes or per day. What we found senseless is that they charge for the minutes from the time you pay not when you are actually online. The hotel is conveniently located in the Museum neighborhood. We could walk to Museo El Prado and Reina Sofia; Parque del Retiro and the Atocha metro station. Best way to have an overview of the city is taking the City Tour Bus, there was a bus stop a block away from the hotel. You can get off and on the bus as you wish for the day, so you can see the main attractions: Royal Palace, El Prado, Gran Via, etc. There are several cafes cross the street if you want to go for a quick breakfast, usually they serve coffee, pastries and a sandwich. For good tapas try Mercado San Miguel close to Plaza Mayor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Quincy20
Reviews.Content: We took our first trip to Madrid, so weren't sure what to expect with the hotels as the reviews vary from traveler to traveler. Were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were spacious and clean. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The location was great. Only downside was the bar staff. They seemed annoyed and less than thrilled to serve us drinks. Overall, our stay was great,

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redwoodsteve
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as it has good reviews and was near to Madrid centre. Not a bit disappointed, great hotel, rooms, service and location. No worries here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city centre location and very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: itsverygrimupnorth
Reviews.Content: We booked here for one night as we wanted a day's sightseeing in Madrid before we continued on by train from Atocha the next morning. We contacted them beforehand to check that the booking was on their system and to enquire about a luggage room facility as we anticipated arriving some hours before check in started. They replied promptly and helpfully and this set the tone for our whole stay. The room was very large and modern with a superb bathroom and the hotel bar was clean, tidy and not overpriced. We did not eat there in the evening as we wanted a light tapas meal after overeating in France but the menu looked quite appealing. We did however have breakfast there the next day and it was an excellent buffet spread with a wide choice which kept us going until that evening in Western Spain. The stay cost us 150 Euros including a booking fee and the two breakfasts and was much better value than you would get in the UK for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDoc78
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated across the street from the Atocha train station, and a short walk from several museums, parks, and numerous restaurants. Internet was a little pricey and the hotel bar closes at midnight, but overall a clean, convenient, friendly place. Staff very anxious to make our stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bunbun2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Our room was clean and the staff were helpful, however it was very noisy from early in the morning while the cleaners worked in the rooms nearby. Internet, breakfast and mini bar were all expensive, so we tried to avoid using these. The hotel seems more like a business hotel where people would leave early in the morning and charge all the extras to their company, rather than a relaxing place to stay while you are on holiday. It's very close to the train station so convenient to get to from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: bearsvilleboy
Reviews.Content: Well located,short walk to 3 museums,2 minutes to the Metro, nice rooms, professionally run, excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGyrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a large hotel, with nice amenities and a great staff. The location was the best part -- a small walk to the Prado and various restaurants. We walked all the way to the center of the city, which was a much longer walk, but still doable. The train station is super close. I can see this hotel being particularly good for business travelers or those who want to hang out at a hotel bar. If I recall correctly, the hotel had a great breakfast buffet, but it was NOT cheap! I guess you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AEast10025
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in the Atocha section of Madrid about a 10 minute walk from the Atocha Bus Station (where you can get a bus to/from Madrid's airport) and about a 5 minute walk from the metro. The hotel was centrally located that we mostly walked to the various sites. Room size was small but clean and nice. Service was great and they let us check in early. Staff was helpful but not very friendly. We stayed for 3 nights and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: DomingoUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here and wanted some where conveninet for the railway station, galleries and sites. The hotel really does have the best location for these requirementa. Our room was at the back on the 4th floor and had recently been redecorated - very clean, quiet and just what we wanted. In the first room the AC didn't work but this was soon dealt with. Staff were fine. We didn't use any other facilities but as we were out most of the time it didnt matter. Real can't fault the place. We arrived late into the airport and took the 2eue express bus into town - this was much easier than using the metro as the final stop is at the rail station and again near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Madrid's Art Triangle”
Reviews.Author: Tony S
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel primarily for it location and I wasn't disappointed. A 5 minute walk from the Atocha Train Station and a few mintes from the three major art galleries of Madrid - the Prado, the Museo Reina Sofia, and the Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza. There's some good little outdoor restaurants and bars in the area (breakfast is not included with the room) and the hotel has a cocktail bar for a quite drink after a hard day at the art gallery of your choice. Well priced (considering it's just as close as the Ritz or the Palace Hotel) with clean and comfortable rooms, and the staff were always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It was beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: staveras
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the most amazing view from my bedroom. The food was delicious. The workers were very polite and welcoming. When i go back to Madrid i will be staying at Husa paseo del arte again. It was an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for everything”
Reviews.Author: chattypops
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay here, nice room if a little small but lovely big bathroom. Secure parking available, expensive but worth it for peace of mind. The hotel is extremely well located for sight seeing and a walk out to all of the restaurants, very busy on a Saturday night. We did some good people watching too !
