Did not try the restaurant in the evening as we wanted to go out into the City and found a great restaurant called Ginger, really good food at a fare price. The hotel breakfast was very good indeed with plenty to choose from. Would love to stay again when in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: evoca
Reviews.Content: This 4* hotel is close to the city centre & Puerta del Sol (around 20 minutes walk) and is less than ten minutes walk to the western entrance of Parque del Retiro. The nearest station is Atocha and this is a great station to be located near if you're travelling inter-city to other areas of Spain. The hotel itself was clean, the staff were friendly and helpful. We had requested a double and were provided with a twin room, however the room had a safe and the bathroom was clean. The price was reasonable, although in comparison to other 4* hotels in Spain on this trip, Husa Paseo del Arte rooms felt slightly lacking.. the linen and decor in the room seemed well worn and a little dated. Our room didn't include free wifi, and the price of wifi here was exorbitant at 4 euros for half an hour; I recommend you go to a local internet cafe instead if you can find one (we couldn't). If you get a well-priced room this hotel offers a location that is great for short stays in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Confortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: CSMEXBOL
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean and good service. Very close to main touristic places. However, just a shower available in the standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not for me...”
Reviews.Author: MariuszKluzniak
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice, good decor, comfortable. The room I was pleasure to stay in was on the 1st floor facing another building. If you need a quiet room to sleep, ask for rooms on upper floors, as I could hear screaming teenagers all night on Saturday. There is Mcdonalds restaurant next door which attracts masses of young people late at night... I have paid discounted price as it was anniversary of opening of the hotel ( I think). I did not feel particularly welcomed by reception. I don't like hotels where you are charged for absolutely everything. The internet was not free and i was informed that i would have more privileges if I have booked superior room. Breakfast very expensive for what's on offer. Gym not particularly good either. I will not be staying in this hotel on next trip to Madrid .

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: mzc61
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights to alleviate the jet lag, walk around and look at some art before flying to Morocco. We chose this hotel because of its location, so close to the Prado Museum, the TA reviews and the price. It is basically a business hotel, clean and modern with an uncluttered and welcoming lobby. When we arrived there were four clerks behind the reception counter and a group of six traveling together trying to complete their check in. One of the clerks was fully occupied with this group, the other was counting money and the remaining two were fully occupied passing envelopes from one to the other. Eventually, they realized that we had been waiting and one of them decided to help... Otherwise, they were very pleasant and the check in was smooth. The room had a nice view of Atocha and it was clean. The bathroom was OK, although the towels were thin and the shower had low to medium pressure. There was no coffee maker. The hotel has wi fi but it charges4 euros / 1/2 hour and you can not use it in chunks. The hotel has a nice buffet breakfast for 19.50 euros that we decided to bypass. We had cereal, toasts and fruit at the hotel cafe that is next to the lobby and quite nice. There are a few places to have a cheaper breakfast (no cereal) and a grocery store (opens after 10am) across the street The best part is the hotel location: 2 blocks from the Prado Museum and a 10 minute walk to Puerta del Sol. Overall it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic food and service”
Reviews.Author: SueSilvers
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay overnight at this hotel, but I did have a meeting here with a private dinner. Although the meeting room was a little tired, we had a private dinner in an atrium next to the main resataurant and I was very impressed by the quality of the food and service. The hotel has a nice bar/cafe in the lobby and I hear the rooms are very nice. Great location near the Prado Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Value, Service n Quality”
Reviews.Author: TravelinSurfDog
Reviews.Content: Loved pretty much everything about this place. Location - Right in the middle, no more than 10-20 walk to anywhere in Madrid Service - Large rooms (European Standards), clean and comfortable - great bathrooms Value - INSANELY GOOD since we paid less than 150 Over all quality was excellent, coupled with location and value, I'd definitely stay there again even though I like trying new hotels. Rooms were very clean and comfortable, though the bed could have been a bit softer but definitely not an issue for me. Would stay and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel near the center of the old town”
Reviews.Author: 155019Daniel
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, only a few minutes walk from the main train station Atocha. Metro is across the street, Le Preda Museum is only a few minutes walk away. The hotel is very new looking, exactly what you expect from a 4 star hotel. Front desk staff was very nice, gave us a nice map of Madrid at check in. Room was very big, nice flat screen TV, big bathroom, tub and shower, bed was very comfortable, very good air conditioning was not loud at all, room was nicely furnish, everything looked brand new, and room was very clean. You can easily walk to all the main sites in Madrid from this hotel, as long as your up for walking all day (many patios where you can stop for a bevy along the way :) ) If walking is not your thing the metro is just across the street and only cost 1 euro for a ticket. Metro is very clean, and your only 2 or 3 stops away to SOL station which is a big plaza with lots of shopping, restaurants, bars etc... If your looking for a very safe, clean and nice hotel in the center of Madrid this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service, can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: jess871
Reviews.Content: Perfect!!! The location was just right, it was a block away from the central train station, a block away from great night life and a block away from the Prado art Museum and so so many other great sightseeing spots. I couldn't ask for anything more perfect. The staff was very nice, the room was large, the gym was great, the bar was fantastic and would honeslty recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Spain. We will definetly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: hoppityhop
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room for the first and last night of our trip to Spain based on the hotel's close location to the Atocha train station. We requested rooms facing the inside (rather than the street). Both rooms were well appointed, immaculate, and very quiet. We walked from the hotel with our bags to the train station and to the 24-hour Bus stop for the airport (about 5 minutes). The pleasant surprise was how nice the hotel was and it's proximity to the museums (Reina Sofia, Caixa Forum, Prado) and Retiro park. We also walked to Plaza Mayor and restaurants and bars in Huertas and Plaza Santa Ana. It's also a great value (check their website for special deals: www.hotelhusapaseodelarte.com). For an inexpensive breakfast, walk out the front of the hotel for atmospheric courtyard of Reina Sofa museum. Note: there is construction going on behind the hotel, but it did not wake us up either morning and was still quiet. Do watch out for the disco (on same street as hotel) on weekends and asks for a room away from that location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: 64Mark
Reviews.Content: If like us you are in Madrid for a short break and want to see the best galleries in the city, this hotel is in an excellent position. It is also a stone's throw from Atocha Station for catching the Ave. The check-in staff were efficient and professional as well as being helpful and friendly. The room was absolutely spotless and quite spacious. The bathroom was modern and the shower worked well. Sound proofing could not be faulted apart from some noise from a rubbish truck early in the morning. Everything about this hotel feels efficient, modern and slightly sophisticated. It doesn't have a lot of character but who's complaining when the rates are amazingly good. There are plenty of cafes and bars nearby if you don't want the hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “good convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunglassesOttawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night - we wanted an hotel near the rail station, and this was very close, but also in the city, close to shops and restauants, and close to a huge park. It had high standards, with a good room and bathroom, and an excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Clean and Nice Room, Great Prices”
Reviews.Author: 0126pb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paseo del Arte during Christmas week 2010 for 7 nights. It was very close to the Metro station and the Train station - so it was convenient if you want to take the train to Barcelona (which we did) early in the morning and coming back late at night. It was also very close to the Prado Museum and Retiro Park - about 10-15 min walk. Front desk was helpful and courteous. No complaints there. We had to order room service on Christmas day since everything was closed and the only restaurant in the hotel was fully booked. The room service food was actually quite good - since I think it came from the same restaurant inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean modern”
Reviews.Author: lnnj861
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, modern and the staff was very helpful.We took the train from the airport with no troubles. Very close to the ATOCHA, train station and to the parks and museums. We had an interior room and it was quiet. We arrived and then mid week took the AVE to Seville for two nights and left our bags with the Husa Paseo del Arte bellman. Made it mush easier to travel on the train and the staff was great. Breakfast was included for only the first part of the trip - when it's not included it's expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but staff very unfriendly.”
Reviews.Author: grace187069
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our party of six, three twin rooms. The hotel is lovely and in a great location, with an excellent buffet breakfast. Make sure you keep windows shut as noise from nightclub dreadful if you are near it. We found the desk staff to be unfriendly and unhelpful when we asked for all the rooms on the same floor, we got this eventually after several trips to Reception. The staff at breakfast we constanly whipping our plates away and we felt rushed when we wanted a leisurely breakfast. The bar was closed when we got back at night (around 11.45 p.m.) so we never got to have a drink there. For excellent food and great service try Pinnochios in the square opposite the Reina Sofia museum but avoid El Tres, facing hotel, awful food and service even worse!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location near Prado + Train station”
Reviews.Author: ready29
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern and above average quality. Easy walk to the Prado and Sofia museums. Skip the breakfast buffet as it is too expensive and there are plenty of breakfast options in the neighborhood. Wonderful city view from the fitness room which has common aerobic machines but no free weights. Great hotel in it's price range.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CBGiants
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located right in the heart of the city, literally across the street from the Reina Sofia and the main train station. Typical 4 start European room, nothing crazy, but very clean. The hotel was very accommodative, they were able to get us tickets to the bull fight in town. I would recommend this hotel for travelers looking for a decently priced hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rueskov
Reviews.Content: Close to train station, metro, restaurants and sights. And all I could wish from a city hotel. At a fair price. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel close to Atocha station and main museums”
Reviews.Author: anapapa1979
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel because of its proximity to the Atocha station and main museums. Hotel is located a few steps across from the Reina Sofia museum and within walking distance to the station, Prado museum, and parque del Retiro. Staff was very nice to us but slow. It seem to me that there were always other people asking questions to reception so we always had to wait. The only negatives were the price for Wi-Fi (not free and one of the most expensive ones in our vacation) and they did not answer the phone when I needed help to get our luggage down. I had to do it myself. If you are coming in thru station and would like to visit the museums, this is a good location. My husband would have preferred a hotel closed to Plaza Mayor but you can get there by metro. There was a great restaurant that served the best paella in our trip just steps from the hotel, across Atocha station.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Atocha rail station”
Reviews.Author: conradmeyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last year for several days and again this year overnight. Its a busy place with travelers coming and going at all hours. Everything is good about this hotel but it is irritating that they have expensive wireless internet charges. Several doors down, MacDonalds offers FREE wireless!

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel with mixed service in a good location - beware twin beds”
Reviews.Author: goanna47
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel we've ever stayed in in Madrid so the service "issues" we experienced may be simply standard there. There were some really good things about this hotel: - the bathroom was a good size; good toiletries like sewing kit, shoehorn (but no hair conditioner) - it was very clean - front desk was well staffed - wooden floors - opening window - nice modern furnishings and bedding - location: nice spot between the botanic gardens, the tapas bars and shopping district, and the museums Things I didn't like: - noise from next door nightclub (Sunday night after we arrived we were woken at 6am by drunken patrons heading home past our window, we were 1st floor side-street facing. If you are a light sleeper ask for a courtyard room) - twin beds pushed together in double rooms - not even joined by shared bedding, just shoved together with separate sheets, covers, etc. - quite small room - no tea/coffee facilities in-room - breakfast was expensive (we went elsewhere) - no free airport shuttle (we paid E22 for two to go to the airport via shared car) - internet (wireless or their "business centre") was exceedingly expensive (E6 for 1 hour or E12 for 24 hours, use this immediately as it starts ticking when you pay for it!) - no ironing facilities in-room - no extra pillows in-room There were also some strange service anomalies - selectively nice/helpful to disdainful/disinterested front desk workers; no information manual in our room (we asked and after 10 minutes trying to explain this we were informed this was being renewed and we could have a copy but had to give it right back - so for 24 hours until it was replaced we had no room service menu or any info about the hotel services or local area); they seemed reluctant to lend an iron and board (could have been language difficulties though). Overall a mid-level reasonably-priced hotel which would be fine for most travellers, but watch out for the noise in lower-floor street-facing rooms, and the twin beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, 15 mins walk from the centre.”
Reviews.Author: featherbum
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Paseo del Arte for the easter holidays. Location wise it was good as there were several cafes and restaurants nearby, which came in very handy as the breakfast at the hotel was very pricey 20euros per person per night so we decided to skip this and go to the coffee shop over the road for coffees and croissants. The city centre (Sol etc) is about 15-20 mins walk away, but there is a tube station nearby which we used a lot as its very cheap at 1euro per jouney anywhere. We enjoyed going to nearby plaza santa ana for drinks and dinner, about 10-15 mins away. The hotel was very clean, the room a bit on the small side but perfectly fine, and sometimes in the night it could be a bit noisy outside as there is a nightclub and some bars but overall we slept well. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Philonous_XXI
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in good location. I stayed at Husa Paseo del Arte for two nights in late August, 2010. The room was relatively spacious, quite and clean. WiFi was a rip off (~25 euros a day, but it is considered a norm nowadays in many places). Parque del Retiro, museums and major transportation, including tour buses, are right there. If you can get a good deal, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good on Basics, not so good on details”
Reviews.Author: AThena53
Reviews.Content: The Husa Paseo del Arte does the basic things well. Our room was large by European standards, pleasant and clean, plenty of hot water in the bathroom. The hotel was in a great location, an easy walk to the Atocha station or the Prado. They falter at the detail level, however. It started when we checked in. When I made the reservation I'd requested a floor away from the street so we wouldn't have street noise in the room. We were given a room on the first floor. Facing the street. When we got into the room, it appeared well-soundproofed so we decided to keep it, but I don't know why my request was ignored. The room had a laundry list of frequent traveler pet peeves: no unused electrical outlets, only 2 drinking glasses per room, exorbitant rates for the Wi-Fi (there was a charge even in the lobby). I highly recommend a snack at McDonald's around the corner for all your connectivity needs. One light bulb was burned out. (It was replaced while we were out the first day after we informed the front desk.) The beds were configured for maximum flexibility and ease of vacuuming, but not for creature comfort: the headboards were fastened to the wall but the beds were on rollers, so if you rested your back against the headboard the bed crept away from you. Our double bed was 2 singles rolled snugly together. There was a thermostat on the wall. It didn't work. Our visit was during pleasant weather and it's possible they turned off the heating/AC but there was no air circulating in the room. Worse, there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom. The only way to get fresh air was to open the window, which let in the street noise. (The windows did an excellent job of shutting out street noise.) During the night that option was completely out of the question because of a large spotlight under the window that would have lit up most of the sleeping area. The hotel has a gym, but I didn't check it out- it was beautiful weather for outdoor running, especially if you're going a long enough distance to reach El Retiro, the former royal park. This is the only hotel with excellent recommendations on TripAdvisor where I've been disappointed. We would certainly stay in that area of Madrid again, though, and there are many other hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Sincere Lack of Hospitality & Service”
Reviews.Author: luhg23
Reviews.Content: I do not usually write reviews of our stays in hotels, but I think the staff / management of this Hotel really need to address the sincere lack of service, interest and hospitality they show their guests - We arrived to this hotel by taxi from the airport - after what we believe to have been overcharged by the taxi, we found the front staff to be very unhelpful in the situation, given that we have limited conversational Spanish we asked the taxi driver to accompany us to the reception area to explain the situation to the staff in the hotel, we did not receive any really helpful assistance with the matter from the staff and were made to feel a complete hindrance - not a very good first impression of the city of Madrid! There was no welcome to the hotel by the staff - not even directions to the elevator. The bar staff were extremely unfriendly and disinterested. We could not believe the price of the WI-FI - absolute extortion! Our room was nice and modern - clean and good quality sheets, towels etc, however we were located on the 1st Floor and spent two of the three nights with interrupted sleep from the street below, until about 6am from people singing, shouting etc, and also from noisy pipes within the room. In particular on the final night of our stay the most horrific and frightening noise came at 5am - with what sounded like 3 explosions outside which i am sure other residents were woken by - however when we looked outside we could see no activity - there was no mention of this upon checkout the next morning and at this stage we just could not wait to leave the hotel and could not even be bothered to mention it to staff, as we would probably of not received any acknowledgment - upon checkout we were not asked did we enjoy our stay, nor did we even get a "Thank You". Despite all of the above, we did really enjoy our trip to Madrid, however we expect value for money in the hotels we stay in and feel we certainly did not receive any sort of value whatsoever. Good location for use of the Metro, day long pass for the metro only €6. Check out Kitchen Stories Restaurant (near Plaza Mayor) - truly amazing food, super and attentive service!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Museums and Train”
Reviews.Author: rob091
Reviews.Content: Sayed one night on the way to Granada. It is a short easy walk from the train station in a quiet area and not far from the Prado and other museums in Madrid. It is a fair walk to the centre of Madrid so depending on the focus of your trip you want to stay closer to Plaza Mayor. The hotel itself is modern, comfortable and nicely decorated - good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for the money”
Reviews.Author: mifhein
Reviews.Content: Our room was relatively small but well kitted out and comfortable. Hotel as whole was very nice and the staff were helpful when required. Our room did look out onto a back street which meant there could be quite a lot of noise (especially on Sat and Sun) nights but it wouldn't put me off recommending this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this Hotel- clean,warm & the staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: spanishstar
Reviews.Content: Madrid- what a beautiful City- a must see on your list and something for everyone!! The airport is an architectural delight too and very efficient. As we live and work north of Alicante in a rural tourist area, we like to go for a break to other parts of Spain for culture and a change of pace. This Hotel was chosen mainly for its proximity to the Prado and other museums, its modern style, the reviews on here, and the good package offered from Expedia of a flight and hotel. We booked 3 nights there. Check in was super- the Hotel was very clean ( we are fussy) , the standard room booked was lovely- but they offered an upgrade for only a little more, so we took it. We stayed in a suite on the 7 th floor- way above the noise with good double glazing over the very busy main road ( 24hrs -lots of sirens, car horns, people shouting especially when a nearby disco was emptying at 4 a.m. and later!) .If you dont like noise then ask for a quiet room. We found a lovely terrace, huge bathroom, large comfy firm double bed , tea & coffee makings supplied, minibar , bathrobe,slippers( for 1) , hair dryer, wide screen TV with different language channels and free wi fi. It was chilly at night and the heating was excellent, lots of hot water too and the toiletries and extras there were excellent.. Everything we requested ( more towels, map, best place nearby for good tapas, getting us taxis etc) was provided and the staff were very helpful and charming. Negative points- only small- the wardrobe in the room was very small but we travelled light. If you have a lot of clothes there were only 5 hangers and a small area- a few shelves, with no drawers at all. The minibar only had beer and soft drinks, no wine, so you have to order wine from room service- although its not on the list- which closes at 11 p.m. ( this is very efficient by the way) A couple of times we came back just after midnight and the really nice Bar downstairs was closed so no night cap! The pillows were not good- 1 large hard one and a small lumpy one each. We didn't eat in the Hotel as we don't do breakfast and ate out every night. The hotel situation was perfect! The Prado was our primary aim. We spent nearly a whole day here- going out for lunch and returning.Ahough it was very crowded ( lots of school trips ), overall the children were very well behaved. This, other museums and Retiro park are just a short walk from the Hotel. The old Town was a 10 min walk up the hill. We took the staff advice and went to an area where there is a lovely square ( Santa Ana) with great atmosphere and some delightful bars and Restaurants. Also the Palacio Real and Cathedral was a few minutes taxi drive too. ( The queue was too long for the Palacio to wait- so we went in the Cathedral museum and up into the dome- at 6 E it was well worth it for the views along) The open top bus tour for 2.5 hrs was great value for money with a head set in English giving you the history and all main things worth seeing. You can get off and on when you like. We got off when we saw another square where it looked interesting and found a brilliant restaurant called La Cuevas- the place, food and service was amazing. Also worth seeing- in Santa Ana square is Restaurant Villa Rosa- where they offer 30 mins free flamenco 2 x a night. It seems a bit touristy when you go in ( fab historical setting though) and they try to get you to eat., bur we just had a few drinks ( the wine was not good quality!) and saw the show. It was well worth it- as the dancing was brilliant ( and we have seen a lot of flamenco in ours years of living here) All other venues visited had lovely quality food and wine and great service. Overall we would highly recommend the Hotel- ( and both of us with work have stayed in many Hotels all over the World) and wish we could have stayed longer. We may well go back as there is so much to see and do. We adore living in Spain and everywhere we go we have enjoyed and generally been treated very well, although it does help that we speak reasonable Spanish. We would highly recommend you visit Valencia City too- that has a wow factor of its own.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - location and price”
Reviews.Author: bluemanc
Reviews.Content: hotel spotless clean modern through out front desk helpfull close to metro if needed Walking distance to all major attractions. easy to find highly recommended gym small but adequate

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Number34
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a normal room, quite roomy for the price. Quiet in room and two minutes walk from Sofia and 5 minutes or so to Prado/Thyssen. Breakfast buffet one of the best I've seen in Spain with excellent Nespresso coffee. Also enjoyed the tasting menu in the restaurant which was great value. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Prado and Reina Sofia”
Reviews.Author: Epona11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paseo del Arte from 1 to 4 February this year. Comfortable and clean with unobtrusive but friendly and helpful service. I am learning Spanish for fun and everyone I spoke to at the hotel was kind enough to speak back to me in Spanish. Everyone speaks English well enough, of course. No problems checking in or out , I had booked via otel.com which was prepaid and worked well - the hotel was expecting us! Plentiful and wide ranging buffet breakfast. It is a business and tour hotel mainly I felt but the numbers of tours coming in did not interfer in any way. We had a room at the back and this was incredibly quiet for mid town. Heating just right. I have stayed in the hotel before facing the Calle de Atocha and that is a bit noisier. Only criticism is that there are no hot drinks facilities in the rooms and as a Brit, I need regular cups of tea. There is a bar at the hotel but cheaper to go to the local cafes. Can highly recommend the little cafe on the corner of the pedestrian square by the entrance of the Reina Sofia (on the road directly opposite the hotel). DO NOT CROSS THERE! Use the pedestrian crossing. Cafe is friendly and local and cheap by Madrid/tourist standards. Fabulous location for the Prado and Reina Sofia as well as the Atocha station if you are travelling south. The Retiro Park is opposite and quite wonderful even in winter. Safe too by the numbers of mum and babies, female joggers and elders. Well policed. Good for all other sites either by the metro or bus system both of which are easy to use. Local shops available near the hotel for water and cheap restaurants for snacks and tapas. Just a hint - popular restaurants are always booked up by tourists and locals - so make sure you book ahead to avoid disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money- Fantastic Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: vleon
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights stay at this hotel returning from a mediterranean cruise that returned to Barcelona. We flew to Madrid on a way back to the States. We chose this hotel because of a combination of its location (it is close to everything- museums in Madrid (two blocks away) La Plaza Mayor (walking distance) and La Puerta del Sol (all of the major shopping centers and stores). When we arrived, we were looking to rent a wheelchair for my mother. The hotel provided us (free of charge) with a wheelchair that we could use outside of the hotel!! The room was very clean, modern- bathrooms were very nice. Bed was very comfortable. The price was unbelivable for Europe- great value!! The staff was incredibly helpful, and even assisting us with booking us at local shows. Breakfast is included- all you can eat buffet. They also have a cafe on site.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: E_of_Virginia
Reviews.Content: We spent New Years in Madrid. The Husa Paseo del Arte is a wonderful hotel. It is very clean, bright and comfortable, except for the beds! The staff was very helpful and friendly. It is located in the middle of the museum district. The breakfast buffet was very tasteful and the staff were very efficent. The room was bright and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vero_PK
Reviews.Content: Overdue review - stayed at this hotel in nov '09. Hotel was very modern and clean. Room was spacious, we had a queen size bed and an additional single bed and we had plenty of space to walk around. Lots of closet space too. Lighting was a bit dark next to the closet/entry area, which was a shame since you could not use the mirror on the wall to apply makeup. Bathroom was also spacious, but bath tub could get very slippery and also there was no place to place the soap or personal shampoo bottles except on the floor. Staff at reception was friendly and helpful. Hotel location was convenient to metro station Atocha just across the street. From the aiport we took the #200/#204 bus for 1 euro to the bus station at Parque Avenidas. From there we took a taxi to the hotel and it costs us $19.50. The meter read $13.30 when we arrived but apparently there is a surcharge for luggage (we were 3 people with 3 small pieces of luggage) and also for evening rides (it was past 10 pm). On the way back, we took the metro at Atocha for 1 euro, connected at Pacifico to line 6, and went to the bus station at Parque Avenidas. From there we took the bus, again 200 or 204 depending on which terminal you are going to, for 1 euro and it took only 15-20 minutes. The hotel area is not exactly the best, but the location is convenient. We walked everywhere –to the old town is about a 20-30 min walk, also around the corner starts the Paseo del Arte walk up to the fountains of Neptune and Cibeles and the Retiro Park is just 5 minutes away. In the evenings there were a lot of young kids on the street, specially by the McDonalds’ at the corner and you could smell pot from the crowd. If that doesn’t bother you, then the location is good. We were not lucky with food, so cannot recommend much. One thing we didn’t like is that in Madrid you are allowed to smoke inside and one time we had to leave earlier because we couldn’t handle it anymore. We did enjoy breakfast at Museo del Jamon, one that’s on Atocha street on the way to old town. Service was friendly, food fresh, wonderful coffee, and cheap prices. Highly recommended if you don’t mind standing at the bar while eating. We do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High class”
Reviews.Author: natasha222
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip in Madrid in October 2010 and I stayed at hotel Husa PAESEO DEL Arte and I must say it was an excellent experience. Rooms were very comfortable and clean with a possibility for a smoking room- which I loved! As well hotel staff was very very friendly and professional. I enjoyed a lot a breakfast which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Stylish”
Reviews.Author: mky84
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Madrid, and it was great to stay so close to some great stuff. 5 minute walk to Prado, 1 minute walk to Reina Sofia, 10 minute walk to Plaza Santa Ana, 15 minute walk to Plaza Mayor, 10 minute walk to Buen Retiro Park, 10 minute walk to Museo del Jamon. 5 minute walk to Atocha train station. There was a Metro Station just a short walk away which allowed for easy access to the rest of the city. The decor inside the hotel was stylish and new, and the rooms were clean and modern. The front desk was kind and understanding given my broken Spanish. I think they speak English if you need. My only complaint is that Internet cost 12 Euros per 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if that is what you're looking for”
Reviews.Author: shaulke
Reviews.Content: Positives: + Clean and modern hotel. + Located close to Prado. Negatives: - Even though it is close to Prado, the actual area is dull with very few restaurants. Looks more like a working neighborhood. - The internet is 6 euro per hour in your room or in a business center?! And the printer at business center didn't work. What is it - 1990? - The service is not particularly friendly

Reviews.Title: “very cozy nearby Atocha station and garden Del Retiro”
Reviews.Author: danaeco05
Reviews.Content: very good food at breakfast, quiet place and friendly people at the front-desk. It is easy to walk to Botanical Garden, Garden Del Retiro, Prado Museum and Reine Sophia Museum .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - shame about the beds...”
Reviews.Author: GandP70
Reviews.Content: Really decent looking city centre hotel, stylish reception area and lobby and really good location for Prado, Reina Sofia and Retiro Park... also only a 10-15 minute walk from the bars up at Sol. The main downside of this hotel was the terrible bed and poor service... Starting with the bed - pretty uncomfortable and really squeaky. We moved rooms, but the second bed was the same. Staff service was not reflective of a 4 star hotel, waiters at breakfast were brusque and clearly not happy in their work. Plates left uncleared etc. A shame really, as this detracted from an otherwise pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mabo84
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located in a very nice area near Atocha Station and the most famous Art museums. All within walking distance. Rooms are bright and spacious. Cleaned properly. Didn't have breakfast,too expensive! Taxis right outside, metro station 2 min away. Quiet area with a lot of green!

Reviews.Title: “Near metro,center and train station”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days. Service is good, the location is not far from the center and you can walk around on foot. The rooms are new and the breakfast is also above average. There is no free wifi internet though. I would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - liked it”
Reviews.Author: callmesnoozy
Reviews.Content: A good hotel for tourists. we stayed one night before flying to Morocco for a week, and they stored our big bags for us. On return we enjoyed our 3-day stay. The room was rather small but that wasn't a problem. It was neat and everything worked. You'd think a hotel like this would have easy access to free internet, but they didn't, which was annoying. Great location, handy to Prado and Raina Sofia, railway station and the city centre. It was a pleasant walk up the road to the main attractions and we enjoyed the experience of just walking and looking at the sights of the city. We didn't eat in the hotel. Breakfast was expensive, and we bought supplies at the little grocery stores opposite. Dinners were easy to find - we ate twice at an excellent little Turkish restaurant/bar a few doors up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: beanstravels
Reviews.Content: We planned to take train/metro from the airport to the hotel but wanted to save time & took a cab (30 Euro). Hotel is a short walk to Madrid’s 3 major museums, park Retiro & botanical gardens. Atocha train station is down the street & metro stop right around the corner. Other attractions such as Plaza Mayor, old town, Cathedral, Royal Palace are a little further; we did the walk a couple of times, but metro is much quicker. The hotel was very clean. Staff was helpful and spoke English. Hair dryer & most toiletries (no hair conditioner) were provided but no iron. The bed was firm, but comfortable. Only downside was the pricey WiFi, which we never used. However, at 85 Euro/night (through booking.com), excellent location, cleanliness, and helpful staff, I highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ZilB
Reviews.Content: We paid euro 255 for 3 nights and for this money you really couldn't go wrong. Location was excellent, near to everything (very near to Prado, Renea Sofia, 15 mins from the market, 5 mins from a huge number of tabernas etc...and even the things that were further afield were a mere walk away - in fact we bought a 10 trip metro ticket and it went unused apart from the aiport journies. The staff were great, very helpful, the room was large, clean, modern, good size balcony (we received an upgrade for being HUSA Plus priority club members), views of blue sky, some roof tops, botanical garden tree tops. It's next door to one of the main night clubs in Madrid but we didn't hear a single beat on any of the nights - and we were staying over a weekend and our room faced the side of the club! AND - miracle of miracles, I NEVER sleep well on a first night in a hotel - slept like a log until 10am the next morning...testament to comfy bed, big enough bed, room temperature etc etc no doubt... Had we paid full price, would I have been as impressed - you know what, I think I would, but of course, great value just makes you want to publicise it!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Crieffsaintee
Reviews.Content: This hotel must have one of the best locstions in Madrid if you are an art lover, a mere 10minute walk from the Prada and the Reina Sofia is just acroos the street. Breakfast buffet has enough choice to satisfy the most selective of eaters

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL....FOR A SHORT STAY VISIT”
Reviews.Author: SAM_D_AUS
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel because of its location, close to train station. Only stayed 2 nights on travel through Spain. Nice room, spacious., not luxurious but was ok for 2 night stay. Booked room with balcony, but should of saved our money, not a great view. Helpful staff, computer access in foyer. Location is 10- 20 min walk to local bars and restaurants and felt fairly safe walking back at night.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice new hotel, well located close to museums and park.”
Reviews.Author: mojave
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights with my adult daughter, on a city discovery trip. We found the hotel very recent, the room of fair size for a city hotel, very nice and clean. Staff were pleasant and efficient. Location is close to the Prado and Thyssen art museums, to the Retiro Park and the main rail station. It is within walking distance to the Puerta del Sol and the Gran Via, the heart of Madrid. It has a nice roof terrace and a well-equipped gym. We did not try the restaurant, we had a light breakfast across the street. Two drawbacks: sleep is often disturbed by emergency vehicles who use their sirens at any hour, and internet access, with one's own laptop or the PC in the lobby, is prohobitively expensive. A fast-food joint two blocks away and a bar across the street offer free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it....... but we had a great deal”
Reviews.Author: rain125
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice, good quality hotel. Our room on the 7th floor had a large balcony and was decorated to a high standard, with everything you would need, (dressing gown, slippers etc). Great location near to the galleries and Atocha station. I wouldn't want to pay the rack-rate though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, good wheelchair accessibility”
Reviews.Author: ClarinsFan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a lovely, very clean, modern boutique hotel in a great location for Musums. Wheelchair accessibility terrific throughout with a roll-in shower and grab rails in the bathroom. Although the light switches are at the correct height, the aircon control and hairdryer and mirrors in the bathrrom are too high as are the hanging rails and safe in the wardrobe. Bed was firm but that suited me. Shower a little difficult to control with tap behind seat in shower. Staff were pleasant and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, including wheelchair users.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 4*, but location makes up for it”
Reviews.Author: Digital_Goldfish
Reviews.Content: There isn't a great deal to say about this hotel. It's well located, near the Atocha station, so perfect for the museums, and day-trips to places like Toledo and Cuenca. It's clean, the staff are friendly, and they have black out curtains. The bathroom is a reasonable size, and it's all perfectly acceptable, and fairly good value for money. There's no wow factor though. It was perfect for what we needed it for - A base in Madrid from which to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Art, Culture, Excitement - right in the middle”
Reviews.Author: Antonio M
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for the Madrid arts/culture focused traveler. Walking distance to major museums including the Prado, you can't go wrong. Decent value, nice rooms which are comparatively bigger than some other hotels. Located on Atocha street which will take you up towards major plazas, lots of restaurants and clubs. The Paseo del Arte is another smart place to stay when visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Why was this hotel so cheap?”
Reviews.Author: tinytay1or1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel, with my partner, from 26th-29th July for a lowly cost of £160. Why was this four star hotel, equipped with a decent gym etc, so much cheaper than it's counterparts? I made a great choice choosing to stay here and would have no trouble recommending it to others. The hotel was located round the corner from Atoche metro stop - probably a 2 minute walk after alighting from the tube. In terms of the sights of Madrid, it was ideal for everything I wanted to see. I used the tube to get to and from the airport and walked everywhere in between. I was on the non smoking (though there was an ashtray in the room) first floor (room 111) and could not fault the room. There was minimum noise (in fact non), a decently priced mini bar, flat screen tv...all the things you would expect from a four star hotel. The bathroom had a great mixer shower with plenty towels that were changed everyday (without request). Oh, the view from the room was dire but I wasn't in Madrid to look out of my hotel window!! I didn't eat in the hotel - unless you can call the free hard boiled sweets food - so cannot comment on this aspect. I did go up to the 8th floor on a daily basis to use the gym. It was equipped with two treadmills, a stairmaster, a bike, a rower, good modular weights (no free weights) and three sit-up benches. Two out of three mornings I was completely alone and on my final morning (Sunday) I was joined by two Americans. Be warned - take your ipod. There is classical music playing - though I don't object to this type of music - it just wasn't loud enough to be of any motivational benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catheine810
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean elegant hotel in a perfect location, so easy to take Madrid tour bus and across the street from train station. Definitely to recommend for a comfortable stay and delicious breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Valued Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fried_burger
Reviews.Content: Location: close to Atocha subway and Atocha Renfe, walking distance to all the art museums and Retiro park, 20 min walk to Plaza Mayor etc Value: excellent value, but perhaps it's because we went in August, absolute bargain at EUR 65 a night for 2 ppl Rooms and facilities: everything's modern and new, I like that no carpet's in the room, good size, quiet

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, price, amenities”
Reviews.Author: tsgil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the first night of our honeymoon and it was perfect. It is located in an ideal spot in Atocha, within walking distance of the Renfe train station, many local bars/restaurants, and it's right next door to a huge dance club called Teatro Kapital. However, we did not hear one sound from the club so it's a great place whether or not you are interested in dancing until dawn. Friendly Front Desk staff, fair price. If you want to be in the middle of everything, this is a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: CrystalBlue_10
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay. I stayed here for two nights while in Madrid. We picked the hotel for it's proximity to the train station, but loved everything else it had to offer. It's in short walking distance to the Museums and a little further to the old town area. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the food was good in the buffet breakfast, the rooms were clean, newly remodeled and spacious. Other than the elevator being small (but typical for Europe or older buildings), I have no negative comments. Thank you for a very nice experience in Madrid!!

Reviews.Title: “When in Madrid and you want to enjoy the city, this is your place.”
Reviews.Author: Indiegoddess
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by the organizers of a festival I was participating in. This place was great. I got in between 3 and 5 am each night/morning and there was someone to promptly and securely open the door. They were extremely good natured. They let me re-up my internet at 4:00 in the morning. The location was amazing, I was able to walk home from pretty much everywhere I went and it's really close to the killer park and the museums. They were really helpful. I asked for a good coffee and they told me about a cafe place nearby and a starbucks. I know I should have been insulted but, hey I figured they thought I was a deranged American who went to Spain to eat and drink what I had at home. I think that was very accommodating and thoughtful. There are always cabs out front. The hotel helped getting me to venues and for chocolate and churros. Quite frankly Madrid is so great, I was barely in the room. This place makes it all easy and I can tell the room was cute from the ichat framegrabs my friends sent me of my late night ramblings.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ErosSlovenija
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Despite the fact Madrid has more than 5 million inhabitants and by that a huge area is involved, you can see big majority of all the important sites by foot, if you will be staying in Husa Paseo del Arte. Plaza Major, Puerta del Sol, Museum Prado, home of Guernica, Gran Via, Atocha station, Royal palace, Cathedral ... everything within walking distance. Furthermore, take bus 27 just across the street to reach Santiago Bernabeu in 20 minutes. Or use metro to travel faster. Hotel rate is extremely convenient (less than 100 EUR/night) for this huge european capitol. Breakfast is very rich, but also very expensive, 19 EUR. Hotel staff is very friendly, bar is nice, I have not tried restaurant though. You may want to try Gin tonic with Bombai Saphire, very descent portions :) Rooms can be noisy, since they are facing the Atocha street, but walking around you should be tired enough to sleep like a baby on very comfortable beds. TV screens are flat LCDs, however choice of programms is rather poor. Internet access is 6 EUR/hour, which is also very expensive. Wifi policy seems a bit strange, since the concierge boy brings you access details, once you order them at the reception desk. I would recommend this hotel for either business or leisure trips.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing restuarant - go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: steve40861
Reviews.Content: After a week in Vigo, enjoying some of the most succulent, flavourful, and freshest seafood, a visit to the hotel at this restuarant was very disappointing. Everything else about this hotel was fine (price, location, quality, staff) but the restuarant was not. They claim to have some quality chefs. Hmm! I had the pheasant salad, which was fresh enough and nicely presented but was drowned in a heavy oil. Then I had stuffed hake, which tasted like mashed potatos with a slight fishy flavour. Overall, very bland. A desire to produce a complex dining experience has come at the cost of delivering a vibrant, flavourful experience. This restuarant is not good value (or taste) for money, so head outside and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaawaa
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this hotel ... 5 minute walk from the train station and museums, clean and large room, big bathroom with decent hair dryer, very comfy bed. Desk staff was courteous and spoke excellent English. Hallway carpets need a good cleaning, but otherwise no complaints. Did not eat in the hotel. Stayed on a Sunday night, so got a very reasonable room rate, think it's more expensive on a weekend night.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, beware noise”
Reviews.Author: silencd
Reviews.Content: Nicely located walking from Atocha station and 10 min walk to Sophia and Prado. Excellent breakfast, good room. Beware: nigh club is right across a narrow street from best rooms at corner. We almost diddnt sleep the night. Hotel is clean, but towels smelled bad laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: chearnaigh
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Husa Paseo del Arte in mid-April. The hotel's location is perfect if you are planning museum tours and need train and/or Metro access. The Reina Sofia is virtually minutes from the hotel. Both the Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza are well within walking distance also. Metro (clean and efficient) is less than a block and the Atocha Train Station is just across the plaza. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you speak limited Spanish you will do well, most staff speak English. Our room, normal European size, was neat and comfortable. Fairly large bathroom. Breakfast was very good (if somewhat expensive). We did not eat dinner at the hotel. Guests mix of tourists, mostly Europeans, and business people. Although situated on a busy street, on the 5th floor we were not disturbed at all. Wi-fi charged by the hour or 12 hour period. If you are planning to use the trains for day trips, would advise buying tickets beforehand. We did, and found some trains (returns from Toledo and Segovia) were sold out. See the Buying Renfe Tickets Online article. It seems complicated but is was actually quite easy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Sam715
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, excellent location right next to the main train station, nice rooms and good service. Although it didn't bother us, the hotel is next to a main road so it can be quite noisy outside in the evenings which made the hotel feel somewhat more chaotic in the day too. Our room was an average size room although we were spoilt by the amazing hotel we stayed in Barcelona so in comparison, it didn't have the 'luxury' feeling even though both were 4 stars. Nothing to complain about though, we were happy with the hotel. Reception area very trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: namila
Reviews.Content: No complaints. We had a great stay at the Paseo del Arte. It was in a great location and the rooms, although a bit small were clean and modern. In particular, the toiletries were fun and cute--matched the vibe of the hotel. Good price, not a bad choice at all.

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient”
Reviews.Author: lesleyman
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. You can walk to most of the museum and tourist spots. 3mins walk from metro if you don't like walking. It's opposite to Sofia museum. Many restaurant near the hotel. You can find like starbucks, McDonald, and many Spanish restaurant around. However there is no supermarket, only convenience store where you can bring drinks, wine, chips back to hotel for late night dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, elegant and well located with a business atomosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Jamarie
Reviews.Content: Literally cannot fault this fantastic hotel, we were very comfortable and would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a relaxing city break. I would say this hotel is more of an adult environment as only saw 1 family. Great location close to all amenities and metro stations. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great and niceee”
Reviews.Author: boluku
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good., the room is very clean and comfy..the staff was friendly, we've got the info for travelling in madrid from them...but the location is not in the city centre of madrid, but we can reach public transportation easily from the hotel...so husa was great hotel for stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a very nice location and delicious breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: wtravellersny
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. The rooms are small, but the bathroom is large compared to usually very small bathrooms in the US hotels. The hotel is very clean and has wonderful location. A lot of very nice restaurants and sightseeings in the neighborhood. Husa rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Strategically located hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinmo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is strategically located near the Atocha Puerto de Madrid train station, perfect for travellers who want to visit other Spanish cities while having Madrid as their base. This hotel is likewise near Madrid's "Golden Triangle of Art", i.e., Prado, Thyssen, and Reina Sofia Museums. The latter is just across the hotel, 100 meter-distance. It is also near other tourist attractions, i.e., Caixa Forum, Botanical Gardens, etc. The hotel could also provide you with a taxi if you need one. You can leave your luggage with the concierge if your flight is still later but you have to check out already. The concierge could send post cards for you provided that you buy the stamps, which could be easily bought right around the corner of the hotel street. The hotel could also provide you with an adaptor if you need one. The internet service is not included in the price, and you have to buy surfing time from them, either 1 hour, half-day, or whole day. The hotel is also good-priced considering its strategic location.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: rider1129
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was everything that you would expect from a four star hotel; very comfortable and the staff was very helpful, but the best part of the stay was the location. We came to Madrid with the intention of exploring the museums and this hotel is literally a five minute walk from each of them. On top of that, Atocha train station is also about a five minute walk. It's also nearby to the Plaza Mayor and the nightlife of Madrid that we could easily walk there for dinner. The fitness center wasn't much to talk about, very basic, so don't expect much, but it's probably about as good as any in Spanish hotels. There was a great view from the top of the hotel that is worth checking out if you go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room and good service at Aocha Station”
Reviews.Author: nursely
Reviews.Content: Walk 5 minutes to Atocha for the Ave train or 5 minutes in the other direction for the Prado....Reina Sophia is less than 5 minute walk. Nice staff, immaculate room and beds, Lovely bathroom and toiletries. Helpful front desk. A great location for travelers coming and/or going from Atocha Station. Two HOHO stops within five minutes' walk. Lovely full breakfast buffet that will keep you going all day. Had a very quiet room on the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good quality, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: mikehSuffolk
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay, excellent city would certainly go back. The hotel was in a great position close to all local amenities including shops bars and restaurants. Pity the bar closed at 12 but there were plenty others close by. Did not try the hotel food as we wanted to eat out. Would have no hesitation of recommending this hotel and they also offered us a room at the back if we were worried about possible noise.

Reviews.Title: “great value and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: brian g
Reviews.Content: good size rooms and bathrooms and balcony, good location not too far from anything by foot, and easy to get to from the airport. a really good find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: JTraveler0000
Reviews.Content: I am very picky and have high expectations for a hotel, and I loved this place. It is very modern looking and clean, and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were a decent size, and while a bit dark, it has everything you need. I read the reviews about the noise from the street so we requested a room on a higher floor facing away from the street and had no problems at all. The bathrooms were very nice as well. I thought the location of the hotel was great. We were able to walk everywhere, you're right across the street from the Reina Sofia and Plaza Mayor is a 15 minute walk. We never needed to take the metro or use a taxi. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and will stay here the next time I am in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near Madrid museums & Atocha station”
Reviews.Author: jooles_p
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the HUSA Paseo del Arte. The modern-style rooms were nice and well taken care of. The bathrooms are large and well appointed. It was very convenient to all of the museums and easy to get to and from the airport. If you are taking the train to Madrid or going elsewhere in Spain by train, it would be a great option since it is near Atocha station. We stayed there three nights, went to Barcelona for four nights, then came back to Madrid to stay there our final night in Spain. Both of the rooms were equally nice, but I think the one on our final night was slightly bigger. We had the breakfast buffet on our first morning and while it is pricey, it is a very good taste of many common Spanish foods like manchego cheese, jamon, chorizo, quince paste, tortilla, pan con tomate, local fruits, etc. Heck, if you like wine (red, white and cava) for breakfast, it's there for you to drink as part of the buffet (we stuck to the fresh squeezed orange juice and excellent cafe con leche). If you're not a brave eater, there's eggs and bacon, toast, cereal, yogurt and other common breakfast items. We really weren't hungry again until it was tapas time. There are many reasonably priced restaurants in the area. If you're an early bird during the weekend, you're probably going to need to find breakfast elsewhere (there's even a Starbucks around the corner that opens at 8 am if you don't feel comfortable at the local diner-type restaurants across the street) The hotel staff is fantastic and helpful. The small bar is great for people watching and the bartenders will bring you complementary snacks to eat with your drink and converse with you in either English or Spanish. We liked the chairs in the bar. If you don’t speak Spanish, most of the hotel staff can assist you in English and if they don't understand, they will find someone to help.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and affordable”
Reviews.Author: doodle52
Reviews.Content: I spent eight months living and studying in Spain - and I decided to go here for my last two nights. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were incredibly well decorated. The bathrooms were also beautiful. The location couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “We Were Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: lchjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, and were very pleased. All of the staff went out of their way to be friendly (most spoke good English). Our room had contemporary decor typical of a modern business-oriented property, and was fine for us. The room was also an excellent value. We tried the restaurant one night, and although we were about the only people there, the food was good. The lobby bar also is nice. If you're driving (as we were), the hotel is fairly easy to find on a wide boulevard. It's only about a block from the railroad station, and just a short walk from the Prado, Reina Sofia (currently closed), botanical garden and vast El Retiro Park which is the best place in the city for running. The only drawback is that it's a good 10 minute steep walk to areas where there are very good restaurants. The Madrid Vision tourist bus does have a stop just steps away from the hotel entrance. Overall, we were glad we stayed here rather than one of the pricey hotels in the more touristy historic area.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelforfun74
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in early July at Husa Paseo del Arte. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and can understand English if your Spanish isn't up to par. We spent many hours reviewing hotels prior to our trip, and I was very happy we chose this one. I thought the standard double room was spacious, considering the size of many European hotel rooms. Sure, the double bed was simply two twins pushed together, but we could live with that. Also, I'm a light sleeper, but there was very little outside noise...the room was pleasantly quiet. We did hear people in rooms next to us and above us, as the floors are wood, and the plumbing is slightly noisy, but it wasn't anything terrible. The location of the hotel was fantastic for visiting the museums and Retiro Park, as other reviewers have noted. I enjoyed the contemporary look and feel of the room too, and the bathroom was large enough for two people to get ready in at the same time. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family traveling to Madrid, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location for art lovers”
Reviews.Author: J0709
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel while exploring Madrid. PROS: Superb location next to the top museums - Prado, Reina Sofia, Thyssen, Caixa Forum. Atocha train stations, Atocha metro station, and bus stops are next to the hotel. Madrid Vision tourist hop-on hop-off bus starts its city rounds next to the Prado museum. CONS: Expensive breakfast in the hotel, but there are lots of cafes, restaurants, and supermarkets nearby. Internet corner in the hotel, but Internet is very expensive - Euro 6 per hour. Used instead a locutoria next to the hotel with Internet service of Euro 1.5 per hour. No lotion in the bathroom. No queen or kind beds even in the double rooms, all beds are twin beds pulled together.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juniper_ie
Reviews.Content: Very cool, modern hotel close to all the attractions. Modern spanish tapas available in the ground floor bar. Internet access is very expensive but there's plenty of internet cafes near by. I look forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KevN10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel- clean, well appointed, close to the attractions. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not again...”
Reviews.Author: MEDTRAV
Reviews.Content: Very good location for visiting museum. Small rooms. Small bathrooms. Extremely expensive Internet service. Couldn't open the window because the resident of the apartment building next to us, could see into my room. Expensive restaurant. Expensive laundry service. We don't remember a hotel less oriented towards the clients satisfaction. Everything we asked for was an extra cost. Front desk helpful if we wanted to buy a tour, the rest of the time, we received the impression that we were bothering them and we speak spanish, so there were no misunderstandings. Not again...

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself and stay here just for the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: melrose4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights (booked through Expedia as it gave an extra £20 discount + Nectar points). We could have upgraded once we arrived but our room was lovely - at the back of the hotel and quiet. Highly recommend and would definitely stay again. Suitable for singles, couples, families. It has a restaurant, bar/cafe (you get a mini toblerone with your coffee!), a gym and sun bathing area. The breakfast (19.5 euros each but worth it) was wonderful - champagne, freshly squeezed orange juice and baked cheesecake, smoked salmon and scrambled eggs, cheeses, cold meats, fresh fruit and other juices, yoghurts, breads and other cakes, fresh coffee and teas - wow! This hotel is convenient for all the main attractions. We got there by using the airport shuttle ( 1 euro each) to the bus station and then a taxi to the hotel (10 euro). Saved a complicated journey on other buses or metro and a much larger taxi fare if we'd caught one from the airport (at least 25 euros depending on traffic) Being Easter week the museums and galleries were very busy so wouldn't go again at this time. A great place to have lunch is the Thysson museum - gourmet 3-course lunch including glass of wine or water 14.50 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Mabell58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance to everywhere! Also practically across the street from Atocha train station. Room was very well decorated and bathroom was huge! BEWARE, Hotel is next door to very large and loud disco. Even though I requested to be away from it, we weren't. Do stay here, but make sure you're not by this disco!!!

Reviews.Title: “comfy hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rodolfo3200
Reviews.Content: We were arriving from Barcelona and the hotel there had been good, we had very high expectations for Madrid, I was 19 years old at the time and the family wanted to have some fun and see as many landmarks as we could. ARRIVAL: We got there by taxi, it was a sunny afternoon and Madrid offered us 34 degrees Celsius, we were anxious for air conditioning and a relaxing room. As we got to the hotel the staff was very helpful and directly took us to our room, when we got there we found a large room with a great bathroom and a nice view of the Museo Reina Sofia area, the windows are large and the decor modern and clean. HOTEL/CONCIERGE: The hotel itself looked new and modern, the common areas were great and there was a solarium on the highest floor, the hotel seemed to be good for business trips as well, I just think it wouldn't fit families traveling with kids, since it has no pool and not many options for children leisure. The concierge was able to help us at all times. STAFF/SERVICE: Room service was great, the staff was always ready to arrange tours and the service in general was impeccable. LOCATION: The location was the high point of the hotel, it faced the Reina Sofia Museum, where is Picasso's Guernica, and it also had many small restaurants around, as well as tour bus stop right on the corner. It was by the side of a large city park and museum so it's a cultural spot, if you're looking for sightseeing and some history it's a great and cheap option. OVERALL IMPRESSION: I would definitely stay there again, it is a quiet cheap hotel with many comfy rooms and very modern architecture, the service was amazing and the location is rather interesting. I wouldn't say the hotel is a destination in itself because it's not exactly a spa/resort, but it has fair amenities and the breakfast is dazzling.

Reviews.Title: “Great location when arriving by Renfe”
Reviews.Author: madflyer
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location, especially if arriving with Renfe to Madrid. Great reception that quickly when I mentioned that I needed to print my voucher from the "Hotels Un-branded" section of Iberia.com hoteles they offered a free half hour of internet and printer. www.hotelesib.com. I got a 68 euro rate here by this site that is shared with lastminute.es . This site does not name the hotel, similar to Hotwire, but in a written discription they actually state that the hotel has 260 rooms and that it is near to the Atocha train and metro stations. They list it as a 4 star. The problem is that this hotel only seems to come up on the Spanish language version of the site. You can get the hotel for around 80 euros on the Husa website sometimes. Room modern, well designed and reasonably quiet for Madrid. Comfortable (king) bed with 2 doubles put together, something that has become very normal in new spanish design hotels. Really liked the rooftop terrace and complete 24 hour gym with great view over the Riena Sofia and towards Atocha. Really nice with the Christmas decorations surrounding from 1 dec to 10 jan.

Reviews.Title: “Next to a large disco”
Reviews.Author: AkbarCanada
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with a central location. However it is next door to the largest disco in Madrid and if you happen to get a room on the alleyway shared with the disco on a weekend night you will not get any sleep. It was a war zone with loud drunks, viscious fights, police cars and ambulances screaming all night. Worst night I have ever had in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shiregirl
Reviews.Content: Check in at reception was very friendly & warm, all staff spoke excellent english. Rooms were spacious & well serviced. Found WIFI expensive at 12euros for 24 hours, but good connection. Room service was average, nothing amazing. Breakfast was very good, large selection of food & all fresh. Fantastic location, 2 minutes from Prado & close to train station.

Reviews.Title: “No electricity and poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: ChristineMadrid2009
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel for two nights. On the second day, our electricty stopped working. We complained at the front desk and they promised to fix it while we were out for the day and night. Unfortunately, when we arrived back at the hotel, the electricity still was not working. We asked for a technician, but no one was available at midnight so someone from the front desk came up but still was not able to fix it. Our electricity was restored in the morning when we called AGAIN and asked for someone to come up. The hotel provided us with no discount for this inconvenience and additionally questioned our recount of the incident as opposed to checking with the staff who we had dealt with. Last but not least, there were ants all over our bathroom floor this morning. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is its location, but for my fellow travelers, there are other hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a great location!”
Reviews.Author: HelloKittyCrazy
Reviews.Content: The Paseo del Arte is a lovely little hotel in a central area, close to the main art galleries and the Park del Retiro. The room was a decent size in comparison to other European hotels, but small when compared to American and South East Asian hotel room sizes; at the end of the day, if all you want is somewhere to sleep, then this hotel is more then adequate. The room was immaculately clean, air conditioned, the bed was extremely comfortable and the in room facilities were excellent. I loved the fact that they provided dove cream shower wash and even a little sponge to shine your shoes. The staff could have been a bit friendlier, for the most part their attitude was indifferent, but in general Spanish people can come across as being that way, it's not that they are trying to be rude, it's just that they like to get straight to the point. However, I would suggest that you check the mini bar contents when you arrive as we left the seal on it and on the third day it had been opened, a can of peanuts had been eaten and the empty can had been put at the back of the fridge. We complained and were not charged for this. The area was a great base camp; we were within walking distance of Atocha mainline train station, Atocha metro station, Atocha Bus terminal and a Madrid tour bus stop. If you enjoy walking around a city then this hotel is also ideally located for walking to all the main sights and museums. In one day we were able to walk around and see all the sights, as well as stopping regularly for a coffee or a caña of beer or (my favorite) some churros con chocolate. For the best churros head to the Chocolatería San Ginés, it's located on Pasadizo de San Gines, just off the Calle de Arenal near Plaza de la Puerta de Sol. It can be a bit hard to find at first but it is well worth it, you'll be back again and again! It's normally at it's busiest in the late evening and the early hours of the morning when people are heading home from a night out. We booked room only, I think that this is the best option as it would have been an extra £15 each a night for breakfast and with so many wonderful cafés around I would recommend going to one of these. I would highly recommend the Museo del Jamón for breakfast; there is one around the corner on the Paseo del Prado and another one at the top of the road that the hotel is on. I was able to get a chiquito de jamón (a small cured ham roll), a freshly squeezed orange juice and a coffee for only €2.40 to eat at the bar (generally things are cheaper if you eat at the bar). Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel, I booked it through Hotelopia.co.uk for only £404 (including a 10% discount that I got buy doing an Internet search for a discount code) for 2 adults, for 8 night’s room only. August is a bit of a low season in Madrid; this is because the average temperature is 38°C during the day, so the Madrileños go on their holidays at this time of year. Many independent shops and restaurants are shut but all the main tourist attractions remain open and the city is in some ways more pleasant because it is a bit quieter. The galleries are not to full and you can spend a lazy afternoon under a tree in the park.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine jumping-off point for Madrid extravaganza”
Reviews.Author: alicetiara
Reviews.Content: We found this place on TripAdvisor and it really is in a stunning location - right near the Reina Sofia and a metro stop, and a quick walk to many other places. The room was hiply decorated but very small - and my tall boyfriend hates double beds, although in Europe there's not much else. We booked such a cheap room that we didn't get breakfast, which was a shame as it looked spectacular, but it was also very expensive and there are two or three excellent cafes right across the street where cafe con leche and pan au chocolate can be found for mere euros. Overall, I was happy with the pick.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect- Location, Price, Staff, Rooms”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustMBA
Reviews.Content: Husa Paseo is a wonderful hotel. Comfortable bed. Soft linens. Clean room. Spacious bathroom. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: skysydney
Reviews.Content: great location next to world class gallerys - room was fine at rear of the hotel - so very quiet to sleep .breakfast was huge buffet and good service - to the point where i went to get a second coffee - and they had cleared my table - i got a shrug and some attitude when i complained . room service was a joke - i wanted some boiling water at midnight to make herbal tea - she said it was cosed and impossibe and slammed the phone down .... i wanted some laundry done on a saturday ( even though it said so in the hotel information ) they said it was wont happen today - whatever!! front desk was buisness like - but dont press for tourist information - not their speed

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel very modern”
Reviews.Author: Stamford C
Reviews.Content: Husa paseo de arte was a gem in the city. We were on our honeymoon and this was the last place we stayed (Valencia and Majorca as well) . Although Madrid has a little different feel, we would recommend it if you want to see museums, not a very safe relaxing feeling overall. The hotel is about a block from the Atocha train station which is worth a visit just to see the turtles in the lobby, and equally close to the metro. The hotel was super modern inside with funky furniture. Spain played Italy in soccer while we were there and won, and we thought the city might burn, but only lots of broken windows including the revolving door at the Husa. Women seemed to clutch their purses tight and there were lots of police around. I guess in madrid you can just pee wherever you want bc it smelled pretty bad in most parts and you could see the pee on the sidewalks. We had a very expensive dinner at Capilla, and it was top knotch, you need reservations it opens at 8:30pm. Our room was fantastic #711, great view over the city, bed was the most comfortable we had in Spain, the bathroom was terrific. Lots of little soaps and shampoo and cologne. Towels were scratchy. Room service was fantastic, just call down and ask for ice. Food was terrific, the bed breakfast buffet we had in Spain and didn't feel like cattle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for museum goers”
Reviews.Author: Graphiker
Reviews.Content: Pleased with everything about the HUSA Paseo del Arte. First of all: the location is superb, around the corner from threee major museums (Prado, Thyssen-Bornemisza, Reina Sofia) and a short walk from the metro and the train station (Atocha). The rooms are sleekly modern, clean, well equipped. It's the only hotel I've been where there was a form to fill out for any maintenance we thought necessary. We did have a small plumbing issue which the management took care of immediately.
