At first we had trouble locating good restaurants nearby; then discovered that a short walk away was Plaza de Santa Ana & a vibrant restaurant and cafe scene. We also found a good bar for our breakfasts, although I see that other visitors thought the hotel's breakfast terrific. We like light breakfasts, so....to the bar for our pan tostada and cafe con leche. The bar: A' Cañada, Calle Futar, 20.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the Husa”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaEddie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Husa three times during our three weeks in Spain, coming back to nearby Atocha Station between travel to other parts of the country. The rooms were immaculate, very modern, quiet. The location is great - walking distance to the Barrio de Lettras with lots of restauarants and the museums. The breakfasts were the best we had in Spain. One of our reservations was inadvertently cancelled, and even though it wasn't the Husa's fault, the reservation manager, Michael, went out of his way to get it straightened out. Only thing we didn't like was that the restaurant was empty at night, very expensive, with a limited menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for travelling”
Reviews.Author: ADL9
Reviews.Content: A great super-clean, modern hotel. It's just a few minutes walk to Atocha Station & the metro. The rooms are very modern & impeccable clean. THe breakfast buffer is superb. The restaurant staff are very grumpy - just not morning people! But the great breakfast compensates for the lack of smiles. THe only down-side is that it's not in the midst of restaurants & good shops. You'll need to get the metro or walking shoes on for that.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel near major art museums”
Reviews.Author: Mariafromnz
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 year old son and I were planning a last minute long weekend in Madrid. 'lastminute.com' had a great deal at this 4 star hotel, offering something like 40% off the usual price. The reviews we found for the hotel were good enough, so we thought 'why not?' We were not in the least disappointed either! The reviews had been very helpful: they suggested that we ask for a room not facing the street and the view as it could be noisy due to road traffic and people queueing for the night club on the street below. We followed this advice and we were extremely grateful! We arrived very late on Saturday night, we could see the crowds of people, and yet when we got to our room it was silent and wonderful! The room was a good size, the bathroom was excellent and it was all clean and very new it seemed. The only thing I would say is that if you like a firm bed (or something akin to sleeping on a slab of concrete!) then you'll love the bed - if not, be prepared for a few aches in the morning! We requested a cot for our son when we booked, and amazingly enough, it was there waiting in our room! (we've had experiences at other hotels where this is not the case). On our first morning, we ate breakfast in the hotel and while the buffet is very comprehensive with a mix of hot, cold and continental items, it was very pricey at 19Euros per person. There are at least 2 or 3 excellent restaurants/cafes accross the road literally where we had coffee and pastries for 16Euros all up! The location of the hotel is ideal for the botanic gardens the Prado Museum, the Retiro Park (which is huge and a fantastic place to take children!) and also the Reina Sofia art modern art museum. It is also very close to the Atocha metro. Also within a short walk is the place where the tour busses depart from (very useful for getting an overview of the city and its layout). It is also close to the major train station. Although the hotel advertises itself as being near Plaza Mayor, it is in fact about a 20 minute walk to the Plaza, but on a nice day, that wouldn't be so bad (the weather was a bit cold and showery for us unfortunately). The staff at the hotel were very friendly and in fact, as people traveling with a young child, pretty much most restaurants and cafes were happy to see a child! It helps though if you teach your little one to say 'hola' and 'adios' - gets plenty of smiles! Be aware though that if you are traveling with a child that needs a high chair (we can cope without these days if we have to) many eating places do not have them, despite what the guide books say! I can highly recommend staying at this hotel and I would be happy to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Europetravels
Reviews.Content: After having Orbitz cancel our reservations on us the week we were leaving for spain at our first choice hotel, I scrambled to find a decent hotel in Madrid for last minute. We found the Husa Paseo del Arte at a decent price including breakfast. I found the hotel very pleasant with a nice sized room and bathroom. The breakfast buffet was great. We had no problem with the staff at all. My only complaint as others have said was about the noise in the front facing rooms. However we were there the night that Real Madrid and Barcelona played so we expected some extra chaos! Location was not bad close to metro, but we mostly walked to everything. Overall we had a great stay and would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “No thrills”
Reviews.Author: belgtravel
Reviews.Content: While its location is ok (on Atocha, walking distance from Plaza Mayor and close to the musea and buzy Huertas neighbourhood), the hotel itself does not offer any particular thrills. The lobby and bar are the same as in any other hotel and staff at recepetion is not particularly attentive neither. Our room was exceptionally small, but however nicely decorated with small flatscreen TV and minibar. We didn't take breakfast. Take care with the expensive hotelparking charge (19Eur/day). Would not particularly recommend this hotel, I think there must be better hotels (price/quality) around with just an extra bit of searching.

Reviews.Title: “Husa Paseo del Arte”
Reviews.Author: Stonerman
Reviews.Content: The Husa’s main attraction is its convenient location, a short walk from the Prado, Retiro Park and the Atocha Renfe (train) station. Walking in the other direction leads to most of historic Madrid, though central city is more spread out than the tourist maps suggest. For some sights, especially if you’ll first be walking around there (such as the Royal Palace), take the cheap, fast and pleasant Metro. The stop is a block from the hotel, and the system can be easily navigated without speaking Spanish. My decent-size room was spotless and tastefully decorated in sleek modern style with fake wood floors and two single beds pushed together, making a “double for single use.” There was a small LCD TV, and they say they have WiFi. The bathroom was large. I could hear some traffic and other street noise in my 5th floor room, although I gather it’s not nearly as bad as around the Gran Via. Basic service was brusque. They tried to bill me for a breakfast I didn’t have, but removed the charge without a fuss. The Husa seems like a second-tier local business hotel, with neither the charm of a boutique nor the professionalism of an international chain. I wouldn’t be looking for them to go out of their way to make your holiday special. In Europe, self-awarded four stars doesn’t mean much anyway. The hotel bar-coffee shop is just an extension of the lobby. It is stark and loud, with weird, uncomfortable seating. No shortage of bars around the Husa, though, or anywhere in Madrid, it seems. If I were to return to Madrid, I might shop around for something more interesting, though settling on the Husa wasn‘t easy in the first place. On the Retiro side of central city there are far more expensive luxury hotels like the Ritz, and then others in the Husa class many of which are trashed on TA. So if I couldn’t do better, I’d certainly return to the Husa.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with easy access to train and metro”
Reviews.Author: Jabbermo
Reviews.Content: DH and I spent 5 nights there during our visit to Madrid. The hotel is just 2 blocks away from the Atocha train station and 1 block away from the metro which makes getting around very easy, and particularly great if you plan to take day trips to near by cities like Avila, Toledo etc via the train. From the metro stop Puerta del Sol and the central district near Plaza Mayor is only 3 metro stops away. While there are not lot of good restaurants in the immediate area near the hotel, it is only about 10-15 min walk to the Plaza Santa Ana where there are plenty of restaurants to choose from. The room is spacious with a modern decor and very comfortable. We never heard any street noise from our room on the 5th floor. The hotel breakfast buffet is a bit pricey but worth a try at least once as they have a nice spread of various foods including the wonderful jamon and lomo! The front desk staff can also appear snooty at times but when we asked we have no trouble getting them to make reservations at various restaurants for us. All in all we are happy with our stay and wouldn't hesitate to go back if we ever visit Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel ...very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: piggytailchick
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Paseo del Arte, really quiet, with very clean rooms. Great value for money. It was about £370.00 inc. breakfast... I do recommend you search long and hard for a good price on the web as the prices do vary. Location is great for museums, and 2 minutes walk to metro (this is really cheap, fast and regular) Get 10 tickets for about 6 euros 70. Although you can walk to the centre in about 15 mins and the streets are great to wander through. We felt quite safe in this area. Food seemed a bit pricey, but it is a capital. Taxi cost about 30euros from airport and took about 20-30 mins. Do be warned traffic to airport at about 8.30am (returning home) was quite busy. Cannot fault hotel for how clean it was - the room was pretty standard in size, but very modern decor. Helpful staff. Breakfast a joy, so much variety, from hot bacon and scrambled eggs to chocolate cake (even red and white wine!!!) Our view from bedroom was a touch disappointing, BUT it was very quiet and were we did not hear road traffice noise at all. We liked: Royal Palace (Palacio Real De Madrid); 8euros (Amazing place, the decor in the rooms is overwhelming!!!) If you go anywhere - go here. Queues are big, so go about 2.30pm/3.00pm, when they are quieter. Bernabeu Stadium tour; 15euros Madrid is a great place for a 3 day visit! (worth getting the Madrid Vision Tour bus first day to get your bearings! (about 17euros)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in amazing location”
Reviews.Author: BDAMom
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat right next to the museums and Retiro Park. The hotel was modern, clean and the staff was helpful and efficient. The only downside was the nightclub next door which opened at 10 p.m. and on weekends there were crowds of people outside the hotel singing loudly at 5 a.m. when the club closed. This noise could be minimized or eliminated by requesting a room not facing the street or a room as high up as possible. Other than that it was lovely with the metro right next door.

Reviews.Title: “That's the place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Maximus80
Reviews.Content: That's the place. The location is unmatchble. In a two blocks waliking distance you can go to: Atocha Station, Reina Sofia Museum (which has the Picasso's Guernica), Jardin Botánico and Thyssen-Bornemyzza Museum. Nearby there is also the Retiro Park, the Plaza Mayor and the Gran Via. The room was very nice and clean, with a great bath. The breakfast is just unbelievable. Various fruits, juices, breads, eggs and whatever you can imagine. Couldn't stay in a better place than that. Definetely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise”
Reviews.Author: Oceanne
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Paseo del Arte after a very long train trip and the Husa "just at the corner " when I got off the train, was a great surprise. Welcome by the reception was fantastic, room comtemporary AND warm (fabulous materials - draperies), huge terrasse well located. The best hotel room I got in Madrid so far for a very reasonable price. A delight. The buffet breakfast is fantastic too, but the staff should be taught to SMILE. The staff at the cafe does not smile and is dressed in black, so... rather cold...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it 100 percent”
Reviews.Author: polyglot
Reviews.Content: The only complaint is that I had problems booking over the website because I tried to write something in the "notes" section of the form and the site couldn't process it so I had to e-mail and call the hotel. That said, it was a highlight of our trip. The room was big, comfortable, nicely furnished, clean, w/a balcony that we could relax on. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and competent. The buffet breakfast was the best of our trip. It's in a great location, just a block from the subway station and 3 blocks from the train station, within walking distance of the museums (the Reina Sofia is across the street), and the Retiro. I want to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for this modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaPTucson
Reviews.Content: Husa Paseo del Arte is a modern hotel that caters to business people rather than tourists. The staff was very professional, but brisk (and a bit abrupt). The hotel had quite a few business groups during the two days we were there and they all seemed to enjoy the convention facilities and the bar/couches in the lobby. Our room was quite comfortable and very quiet. Because it's a new hotel, the bathroom was large with lots of amenities. The breakfast was outstanding. I've rarely seen such a large choice of food and it was all delicious. The location is superb because it was a short walk to the Prado and other museums (and not too far from the Retiro Park). It's also close to the Plaza Mayor and many, many good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Rich_Bronx_NYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place to stay if you are a first time visitor to Madrid. It is within walking distance to the 3 major art museums in Madrid (Prado, Reina Sophia, and the Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza) plus there are tons of restaurants across the street from the hotel - from inexpensive coffee shops to more formal sit-down restaurants. The metro station is a 5 minute walk from the hotel, which you can use to explore the rest of Madird. The big Atocha train station, which is where you can take a high speed AVE train to other parts of Spain (like Toledo or Seville), is also very close by. The hotel itself was very clean and modern. The room had a nice high def tv (only 2 english channels, the rest were a mix of spanish and other european languages) and the front staff was very courteous and helpful. The one thing the room did lack was an alarm clock - you will need to bring your own or rely on a wake up call. Overall, I was very pleased and I plan to stay here again when I return to Madrid next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, staff & location”
Reviews.Author: atstewart
Reviews.Content: I was in Madrid on business during July 2007 and spent 8 days at the Husa Paseo del Arte. The price I paid was 160 Euro/night I felt it was a bit expensive, get the breakfast included in your room if possible, but it was a great hotel. Minutes from everything - Parc Retiro is only a few minutes walk in one direction and Plaza Mayor was about 15 minutes walk in the other. Excellent location and close to everything that you will need. You can walk to most major tourist attractions within about 25 minutes, otherwise the metro station is 5 minutes walk away. The staff was also extremely courteous and very helpful in recommending restaurants. Try El Centaur del Prado (15min walk) from the hotel - excellent food and service. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “my new home in madrid”
Reviews.Author: david2311
Reviews.Content: i have been 2 nights at husa paseo del arte with my wife and my daughter (4 years old). our room was very wide, the funrniture meravellous, the bath fantastic and with a lot of complements. The hotel is new and you can look it in every place. the breakfast is the best i have had in a 4 stars hotel. the waiters very servicial and it lasts till 10:30, so you can sleep a litle more to have it. it takes you less than 5 minutes to reach atocha station, and you have the museums even more near. i'm planning return soon.

Reviews.Title: “We wish we could have had another night”
Reviews.Author: AntSouthofEngland
Reviews.Content: We were sorry we had only one night to stay here. Our room was not large, but was rather chic and modern in design (as is the rest of the hotel) and was clean, comfortable with a large, clean bathroom en suite. Comfortable bed. Air conditioning worked a treat. We enjoyed the breakfast, which was included in our online deal - though we seemed to have been charged for the single cup of coffee we had with breakfast, without having been told that this was not part of the deal. Helpful staff. We needed to leave our bags at the hotel for most of the day after we had checked out. This was no problem to them and we were not charged for it. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LM123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on 30th June 2007, the location was excellent, close to the El Prado museum and within walking distance of shops and restaurants. The staff on the front desk were very helpful, they gave us a map and marked out the best places to visit. Breakfast was fantastic, the variety was excellent and food was gorgeous. We parked our car at the hotel and found it to be reasonably priced, 18 euros for 2 days. Even though we checked out of our room at 11am we were able to leave our car till 6pm. I would definetly recommend this hotel for other travellers, very reasonably priced and good location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: lindyloocardiff
Reviews.Content: Excellent, everything. Location great for museums and Paseo Del Prado. Couldn't find any fault with hotel, better than average for city location. Breakfast great with plently of variety and served until 10.30am . Excellent rooms, service great. Would recommend to anyone. If taking the metro from the airport get off at Anton Martin and walk down Atocha as it easier than from Atocha station. Hotel made the break as we had our passports and documents stolen on the metro, so be aware. Spoke to other people who had the same experience in Madrid. We are seasoned travellers but were caught out, so keep your distance from everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Found the Paseo a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: seashell
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days at the Paseo del Arte and since it was pouring rain and thunderstorms all the while, I was very happy to find myself in such a comfortable hotel. I found the staff to be very helpful and my every request was met in short order and with a pleasant manner. There are two fine examples of this. When I first showed up after an overnight transAtlantic flight, I was a few hours early for check-in. The manager took personal care of setting me up to have a coffee in the restaurant while waiting for my room, despite it being closed to those not having pre-booked breakfasts. He then went about having a room made ready within half an hour. While the second example will seem an odd compliment, I tell it anyway because of the pleasant way I was treated. On my last day, I called reception and asked them to confirm my flight to Barcelona and order me a taxi for the following morning. I was advised it would be taken care of right away. When I still had not heard back 2 hours later, I called down again to enquire. However, the person I spoke to the second time, did not have as good English as the first. She told me that the hotel could not/did not do that and I would have to use the internet to check my flight. Most confused by this, I went to the lobby to use the internet. Fortunately, I managed to speak with my first contact, who most pleasantly advised that everything had been taken care of . Near as I could tell, the second person knew that they had already confirmed once and that was why she was telling me to use the internet. While it is true, that the miscommunication could easily have been avoided had the front desk called me to tell me all was in order, I still felt it was handled well and most of the confusion was mine. And for what it's worth, the bellboy always greeted me with a smile as well as most efficient handling my bags both on the way in and on the way out. I mention this because this was not the case anywhere else we stayed. The breakfasts were incredible and not to be beat anywhere on the rest of our trip around Spain. I wouldn't hesitate to take the breakfast package again. I never needed to worry about lunch. Though one could probably save a little money eating breakfast elsewhere, there's not chance that it could be better value. The hotel is more modern and trendy than I'd initially wanted for my Madrid experience, but later in the trip, we spent 3 days at the Palacio San Martin, near the Opera house and that satisfied my desire for a more elaborate room in keeping with the historic. My room at the Paseo was on a side street with no view of note. However, it was very quiet and that's just what I requested and needed. I never even heard any other guests. I went up to the sundeck (well, during my time there it was the rain deck) and gym, to take some great shots of what can be seen from the top front of the hotel. While the Paseo is not located near the Plaza Mayor nor Plaza del Sol, where there is so much more energy, it is very well situated for the Prado and Retiro Park. I regret that the weather did not allow for me to enjoy the walking about. A metro station is just up the street (or at Atocha) and I bought a 10 ride card for $5 Euros (half the price of buying single rides). Having met up with my travel companion in Barcelona and once back in Madrid, we both made good use of the card. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Paseo again. I had a most pleasant experience with the staff and find it surprising that others did not have the same. A small bonus was an actual double bed, instead of the usual offering of two twins shoved together. All that said, I would probably split my time again between staying at the Paseo and another hotel closer to the action up at Plaza Mayor/Plaza del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast I have ever had and lovely overall”
Reviews.Author: AndrewAustralian
Reviews.Content: My travel agent got me this place for around 100 Euros a night, bed and breakfast, for 2. The rooms are lovely, with nice art in them. The floors have an old world elegance to them - floating wood floor feel. The breakfast was amazing. Over 20 dishes, and the fresh bread was the best I have ever tasted. At least the sort I chose was (they had lots of different breads). They told me it is called Tapata bread. I have not been able to get it in Australia. The location is superb, around 10 minutes walk from 3 world class galleries. Make sure you get the 3 gallery pass when you go to the first one. I am the customer from hell, and expect perfection. Rang the front desk a few times for minor things to be done, and every time they performed fast, and politely. Once I asked for extra pillows. They put long ones in. I then asked for shorter ones. The person I asked to do this did not understand. I asked for an interpreter. They provided an interpreter from staff. They then fixed it. All politely. Another time I could not work out how to make something work. Within 5 minutes they had someone there patiently showing me. The highlight was when I came back after travelling around Spain and asked for a room. They said 120 Euros. I then started chatting with the Manager. I said "I love this hotel." He remembered me as well, as I used to talk to him a bit before travelling around. With a wry smile, he said "Give this man the room for 100 Euros". I then asked if I could have breakfast free as well. He said no, I would need to pay 20 Euros for that, but he said it with a smile. Overall, an awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Husa Paseo del Arte”
Reviews.Author: LollyB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Husa Paseo del Arte. Stayed in a triple room which was big enough for the 3 of us to spread out all of our clothes, shoes etc. Hotel was excellent with a great selection of breads, fruit, cereal, cakes etc. for breakfast. The coffee was very good too. Had a room at the back of the hotel so it was very quiet. Hotel was a very good size with an excellent shower and shampoo and shower gel supplied. Also found the staff very friendly and helpful. We had dinner our last evening at Botins, which was excellent and the waiters were lovely and very tolerant with 9 ladies trying to choose what to eat and drink. Spent the other evenings eating in the Playa Mayor area. The hotel was a leisurely stroll to Playa Sol and Playa Mayor where we spent most of our evenings. Found a great Irish Bar near Plays Sol where we went to end our evenings. Served a very very large G&T for 5 Euros!!!! Can definitely recommend doing the open top tour on the bus, especially the historical one. There are some amazing buildings in Madrid. It cost E15.30 for a one-day pass and E20 Euros for a 2 day pass. We bought our tickets from the hotel reception. Didn't enjoy the modern one quite so much but we did get to see Real madrid's stadium (which I found quite ugly from the outside actually). The only annoying thing was everytime we sat down to eat we were surrounded by street musicians who then promptly shoved a hand in front of you for money. Think they soon got the message to move on. Had a fantastic time and hopefully will return in the near future. LollyB

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: claydo
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 day stay. Was very impressed with the hotel and all Madrid had to offer. From the airport it took about 30 minutes on the Metro to the hotel. Checked in at noon with no problems at all. Booked holiday through Travel Republic and would definately use again. The hotel was modern and very clean, and the buffet breakfast had a great selection. The hotel is located about twenty minute stroll from the Sol area, where most of the shops are. From the hotel its a ten minute walk to the Plaza Mayor where there are some very nice Spanish restaurants. There are two nearby Metro stations, Atocha which is about four minutes away across a busy road, or Anton Martin which is a bit further away, but on the same street (Calle de Atocha). Getting round Madrid is a breeze with the a ticket costing 1 europer trip. Visited the Prado Museum which was 6 euros and a great way to spend a couple of hours (and only minutes from the hotel), and The Royal Palace, which was free to EU citizens on a Wednesday with your passport. Both highly recommended. Just one negative, a Thai restaurant called Thai Pad, on Pase Del Prado. If you like your food tough, and badly served, then this is the place for you. Otherwise, it was a superb trip. To leave a waterlogged Luton on a Monday morning, and return 3 days later with a tan is always a good result.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay - lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Julie032
Reviews.Content: Our room was 305, a small non-smoking room which overlooked a side street. We had no problems with noise. We arrived around 8:30 am and they were able to check us in immediately!! Quiet and clean with an excellent breakfast buffet that seems to cater to many nationalities. Only a few warm dishes but otherwise extensive. Location is close to Atocha train station, museums, and Calle Huertas (tapas bars). To get to Sol, Plaza Mayor, and especially the Palace is a bit more of a walk. Most/all the reception staff we encountered were courteous and could speak English. Check-in/check-out were surprisingly smooth since we'd pre-paid. A free room safe is provided. There is a review with a comment about being "steps" from a peep show. Don't let this comment play into your decision. If I'm not mistaken, they are referring to a place that is several blocks up the street, across from the Tryp Atocha (where we stayed at the end of our trip). If you read the Tryp Atocha reviews, you'll notice that people say they never saw anything unseemly and felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Smart and near vmain museums”
Reviews.Author: photoenth
Reviews.Content: The rooms were smart and clean. Good size bathroom although they forgot to leave fresh soap one day. Reasonable choice for breakfast. Staff friendly and helpful. The hotel is situated 3 to 10 minutes walk from the three main art museums, near Parque Retiro and close to Atocha railway station. Otherwise the area offers nothing exceptional. It takes three metro trains to reach from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Only OK you could do better in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: dubfam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property recently, on a girls weekend away and was a bit disappointed. Overall it was OK, the rooms were fine, recently decorated and the reception area was modern , the overall effect however, was a cheap attempt to look modern/trendy. What I really wasn't happy about was the lack of friendliness and downright indifference of the staff. They really made no effort whatsoever to be helpful or welcoming or even to interact in any way with us. I was also disappointed with the location which while central enough, was on a very unattractive main street and a few steps away from a live sex show theatre (the only one that we saw while in madrid) which made for a slightly uncomfortable walk home in the evenings. This hotel wasn't cheap and I really didn't think it was worth it. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: fmacmillan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights at the end of March 2007. Our whole experience of this hotel was positive. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was very modern and clean. The breakfast was of high quality with plenty of choice. However, once something was finished it tended not to be replenished - so you might want to get there early. The location of the hotel was right in the heart of the art district within 5 minutes walking distance from the Prado, Thyssen and Reina sofia museums. It is also within walking distance from the major tourist areas (10 minutes). If you would rather not walk the hotel is situated between Atocha and Anton Martin metro stations. All in all we would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here if visiting Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBCB
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to main museums. We were able to walk to many of the main sites. Breakfast was great. Room very good and staff were friendly. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Alekito
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in an ideal location. It's 2 mins from Rene Sofia, 5 mins from the Prado. The rooms are large, clean and confortable. The hotel is stylish and has a good bar. The breakfast is fantastic and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Really if you are staying in Madrid you would be hard pushed to find better. It's right in the centre, you would hardly need to use a taxi or metro. When I go back to Madrid I'll stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SuzyWho
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely perfect hotel. Brilliant location, modern interior and friendly staff. In fact I thought it was more like a 5 star than a 4 star. I could not fault the room at all, and I am pretty good at nit picking. The beds and pillows were the best we have slept on in a hotel ever. Breakfast was fantastic. Something for everyone and loads of it. Cerials, bread, cooked stuff, cheese, meats, fruit, cakes, pastries and all the usual juices. Eat your fill and it could last you all day ! Just one recommendation, bring your own teabags. Continental ones are never quite the same. If I was going to Madrid again I would definitely stay at this hotel. I got a fantastic rate from hotelclub.net so would use that site again as well.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pitufala
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the MAD airport exhausted from our flight from the US and were happy that the hotel was right next to the ATOCHA station, literally, so we checked in smoothly and were pleasantly surprised with the rooms, really modern and W hotel style. the hotel was great and new looking. it had a great gym on top (well not great great but better than most for sure with a nice view of the city) but the best thing was the buffet breakfast every morning..yummy...great tortilla de patatas and hams from spain, funny but it is the best food i had i think my whole trip, it might be because it was included and europe is so expensive now we barely ate local stuff. very happy with the hotel. madrid is small so even though it is norther than the city centre very easy to walk to center.

Reviews.Title: “Professional...”
Reviews.Author: Lord-Vader
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of a chain of Husa hotels in Spain. There are a number of 4 and 5 star hotels. This was a 4 star hotel. But as they were part of a chain of hotels I found them very professional and hospitable. It is located very conveniently near most attractions in Madrid. 3 museums (Prado, Thyssen and Rene Sofia) were located within walking distance. There is a Metro station (Atocha) just around the corner (1 minute away) which will bring you basically everywhere. The hotel itself is located in a busy street. There are numerous shops opposite and a number of Tapas eateries. There are always a lot of people on that street loitering around but it always felt safe. The rooms were of good size and the bathrooms were clean and had good showers. The rooms were cleaned everyday. There was an electronic safe in the room which is very handy. The hotel had flat screen TV in the room but only a limited selection of English channels (mainly news channels like Sky and CNN). We had no problems with air conditioning and had a pleasant sleep. There were no coffee/tea provided in the room. The breakfast was a large spread. It could get very busy but there was always space available. The staff could understand English and were very helpful. They were able to recommend places to visit, give directions and even recommend and book a Flamenco performance for us (with a group with which I believe they were affiliated with). Overall this was a very professional hotel. It is rated as 4 stars and I would agree. Probably one of the only so called 4 star hotels that actually compare to what I perceive to be 4 starred. The price was very reasonable and in a similar range to other so called 4 star hotels. Definitely worth staying again and for the price a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: villalobosd
Reviews.Content: WOW! Perfect location, beautiful room! Just steps from Reina Sofia and El Prado Museums.... Breakfast: 14euros (100% recommended!... included eggs, fruits, smoked salmon, fresh squeezed orange juice, cheeses, Iberic Ham and wine!!!) Internet: WiFi/ 12euros per day Vision Madrid tour: You can pay the tour at the front desk 14euros /day, service/bus available from 10am to 9pm (unlimited rides!!) Rooms: My room was nicely decorated and included flat screen TV, a desk, and two twin beds. The bathroom was spacious...dont bring your personal care stuff... shampoo, shower gel, shaving kit etc are included. Museo del Prado: If you visit Madrid for the weekend, visit El Prado Museum on Sunday, is free!

Reviews.Title: “Nice design, so so service”
Reviews.Author: Simon145
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite new, has nice design. and good location. There is little information in the room. I.e. how to contact room service. The restaurant has an interesting menu, but it works out quite bad. Soups where cold, main course not hot either, meats not cooked like we wished. Wine is poured in before having a taste! We did'nt take breakfast, but went opposite to the traditional bars instead. On the corner there is an excellent tapas bar as well called Los Zuritos.
